loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 40 years old and married with four children. She lives in a rural village of Barumbong. For the past four years, Gloria has been raising pigs and selling groceries to support her family. She also buys and sells rice in her local area to earn more income. Gloria earns about 250 PHP each day to meet her family’s needs.

Gloria is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan to buy pig feed to nourish her pigs. She will also use a portion of her loan to buy more rice to resell. Gloria hopes her loan will enable her to increase her income and expand her current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed to nourish her pigs and rice to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella wants to develop her sari-sari (general store) business; this leads her to ask for a loan amount of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase biscuits, breads, vinegar, cooking oil, noodles and soft drinks. She is preparing for the development of her family. She really wants to provide her family with a good living, so Estrella is working hard to make a profitable income.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, breads, vinegar, cooking oil, noodles and soft drinks.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles, 49, is a humble merchant from the village of Barumbong. She lives with her partner and her three children. For four years she has been running her own grocery store, which she began with only a little capital selling snack food. She sold enough to invest, little by little, in her business, turning it into a grocery store in an effort to earn more profits. She sought out financing to buy more products in order to attend to customer demand.

Angeles is requesting a loan to buy staple goods such as rice, sugar, and beans, as well as school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, rulers, etc. In an effort to expand her business and obtain more income, in the future she would like to turn her grocery store into a general store. Another goal of hers is to set up a food business.

loans.use: to buy staple goods such as rice, sugar, and beans, as well as school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, and rulers,.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia believes that "Patience and sacrifices are the keys to success."  She is 61 years old and has six adult children. They live in a rural community and work in farming and hog-raising. Due to financial constraints, Aurelia aims to improve her hog-raising business to generate sufficient income. 

To improve the business, Aurelia is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and vitamins needed in hog-raising. Through her patience and hard work, she believes that someday she will make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins needed in hog-raising

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Rowena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like rice, soft-drinks, canned goods, and other groceries. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, soft-drinks, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 27-year-old married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a very hardworking man who swears never to live in poverty despite his poor background. Jackson trades in coffee and also has a retail shop where he earns a daily income. The coffee business is seasonal and requires a lot of labor input to collect from different farmers. Nevertheless, he has been able to reap tangible benefits. Jackson intends to use this loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to resell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia has been operating her hog fattening business for three years now, but she is still struggling to reach her desired income. She wants to earn more than her usual profit to support her family. Right now, she is prioritizing her hog fattening business in order to make progress in her business.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of P 10,000 to buy one additional pig to raise, and feed and vitamins for the pigs. She hopes this will provide a better income to improve their current living standard.

loans.use: to buy one additional pig to raise, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, who is 55 years old, is married and has four children. She has operated her retail store in her village for nearly 20 years. She earns approximately PHP 6,000 a month. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders for PHP 7,000 to purchase grocery items to sell in her retail store. 

Editha is determined to improve her business so she can supplement the needs of her family. Her profits will be used as additional working capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell in her retail store.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is 49 years old. She has been engaged in a hog-fattening business for more than a year. Her biggest business challenge is a lack of food for her pigs. So she is requesting a loan  of PHP 5,000 to buy  enough feed and vitamins for her pigs. This will enable her to better nourish her pigs and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy enough feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old, married, and has four children. With one child currently in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for her family.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, vinegar, sugar, bread, etc. Erlinda has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, vinegar, sugar, bread, can goods, etc. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store such as shampoo, vinegar, sugar, bread, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 35-year-old man, married with ten children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He describes himself as a hard-working man operating a produce business dealing in maize, beans and groundnuts which he has operated for a period of twenty years now. The business is rural-based and he started it to enable him get daily income for the smooth running of his family. He would like to build a permanent house for his family and educate his children up to the university. Joseph is requesting a loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.en: Dionicia is a 58-year-old married woman. She has raised and cared for pigs for almost five years now. She has asked for a loan to buy more fertilizer and pesticides for the rice field and feed for the pigs. With this loan, she hopes she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pesticides for the rice field and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy local brew and maize to sell.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en: Madelyn is 40 years old and engaged in hog fattening. Because of experiencing food scarcity with her family, she has been doing this to earn income. She wants to raise more hogs to earn more income. She was grateful to know about Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. who are helping the needy like her. So Madelyn is asking for a loan amount of P 7,000 to buy three pigs to raise. She hopes this will be a stepping stone to fight poverty.

loans.use: to buy three pigs to raise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for dairy and livestock business

loans.name: Michi

texts.en: Michi is 40 years old. He is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Michi provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for more than 20 years and earns about PHP 300 daily. He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 that he will use to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish net, fish hooks, and tie wires.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia is 58 years old and married with ten children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Eusebia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Eusebia has been buying and selling livestock for four years and also earns additional income from a beauty salon.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 39 years old, married, with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates a vegetable business in the local community. She has been with her business for over five years and earns PHP 3,000 every month. 

Rosemarie joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2007 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 4,500 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: María, tiene 62 años de edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y como vigilante en una empresa privada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Intibucá. Hace 15 años que doña María se dedica a su propio negocio de confección y venta de delantales o gabachas de cocina para vender. Ella trabaja en base a pedidos. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo a ODEF el cual es por 6,500.00 Lempiras y los utilizara para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de delantales como ser la tela, hilos, encajes etc. su meta es apoyar a su familia con las ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 62 years old and married.  Her husband works in agriculture and as a watchman at a private company.  She has two children, and she lives in the Intibucá municipality.

María has had her own business of sewing and making kitchen aprons or ‘gabachas’ [traditional Guatamalen aprons] to sell.  She works by orders.

She has decided to request a second loan from ODEF for 6,500 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy raw material to make the aprons.  She will buy things like fabric, thread, and lace, etc.  Her goal is to support her family with the income.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make aprons to sell.

loans.name: Evah

texts.en:
Evah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling personal products in the Philippines.

Evah requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more personal products to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Evah would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 37 years old, single, and has one child. She is still running her food stall business. Her monthly income has increased to 16,000 KES.

Josphine is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD for 60,000 KES, which she will use to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, salt, cooking fat, and oil for her business. The anticipated income will be used to pay school fees for her daughter.  Her dream is to see her business prosper.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, salt, cooking fat ,and oil for her business.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 27-year-old, married man with two children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a local brew business and has been in business for five years. In order to earn extra income, he decided to venture into a produce business, using the savings from the local brew business. 

He dreams of building a permanent house for his family and buying a vehicle in the future, despite inadequate capital which affects his business growth. 

Nicholas intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 56 years old. She is married to Francisco. To make a living, Perlita provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns about PHP 300 daily. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 that she will use to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of her transport motorcycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of her transport motorcycle.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Eufemia works hard to support her family. She has a food production business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation. Eufemia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business

Eufemia has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is married to a farmer and they live harmoniously in a rural community. They were gifted with four children and they want them to earn a degree so that they will find a good job someday. In this regard, Flora engages in a hog-raising business to help her husband in generating income. She planned to  raise more pigs to sell but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of P 15,000 to buy more feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Despite the hardships in farming, she believes that she will improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 28-year-old married mother of an infant. She lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City. Grace has been sewing for three years, earning a monthly income of PHP 4,000, which is fair enough to cover day-to-day expenses.

Grace joined Gata Daku MPC in 2007. She has applied for a loan of PHP 4,500 from the cooperative to buy sewing materials such as textiles and thread. By having all the necessary materials, Grace hopes to create as much output as she can to earn more income. She is also planning to expand her business area and/or to buy another set of sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as textiles and thread

loans.name: Clare

texts.en: Clare is a 22-year-old  married woman with two children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. A year into her marriage, she realized that her husband could not provide for her all her necessities and she had to start a business. She operates a retail shop and also has a bar. She got her initial capital from a loan that she borrowed from a village saving scheme. Price fluctuation affects her business while her dream is to expand her business and modernize it. Clare intends to use the loan to buy sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 45 años y esta casada con Carlos. Ellos  tienen 2 hijos de 16 y 12 años; y viven juntos en su casa propia.Silvia es una mujer emprendedora y su actividad principal es la agricultura ,razón por la cual siembra arvejas, habas, espinacas, zanahorias, y otros. 
Comenta que la clave de las buenas ventas que realiza está en la programación de sus sembríos, por ejemplo ahora empezará con la siembra de arvejas ya que en octubre sus precios son mejores.  
“Ahora pienso sembrar arvejas y habas, porque ya estoy cosechando espinacas y lechugas, con mi próximo presupuesto invertiré en abono”, menciona.En sus 25 años como mujer del campo adquirió terrenos que piensa ahora extender ya sea comprándolos o arrendándolos. Se siente contenta con su trabajo porque es lo que le gusta hacer.Éste sería el tercer préstamo que Silvia recibe de MFP y se siente agradecida por el financiamiento prestado.Silvia comprará 1 bolsa se semillas de arvejas, cuyo precio es de 450 soles, lo restante será para algunas urgencias dentro del trabajo.
texts.en:
Silvia is 45 years old and is married to Carlos. They have two children, ages 12 and 16, and they live together in their own house. Silvia is an enterprising woman, and her main business activity is agriculture. She plants peas, broad beans, spinach, and carrots, among others.

She says that the key to her good sales is in her sowing schedule. For example, now she is starting to plant peas because the prices are better for them in October.

"Now I am planning to plant peas and broad beans, because I am already harvesting spinach and lettuce. With my next budget, I will invest in fertilizer," she says. In her 25 years working the fields, she has acquired plots of land that she is now planning to expand, either by buying or renting them. She is happy with her work because this is what she enjoys doing. 

This will be Silvia's third loan with MFP, and she feels grateful for the financing she has been given. She will buy one bag of pea seeds, which costs 450 Peruvian soles. She will use the rest of this loan for some necessities in her work.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Angelina Maria's Group

texts.es:
La señora Angelina Maria esta soltera, tiene 21 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion secundaria, ella se dedica a la artesania, especificamente en la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos, inicio este negocio cuando aprendio a tejer con sus papas, tiene hasta la fecha 8 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un prestamo, que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos para tejer sus procutos. ella en el futuro muy cercano quiere ver su negocio proserado y tener trabajadores. Las demás integrantes de grupo se dedican a la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos y a sembrar verduras. 

En la foto aparecen 11 señoras, pero, solo a 10 de ellas se les otorgo el prestamo porque una no lleno los requisitos.
texts.en:
Angelina Maria is 21 years old and single. She studied at secondary school for six years. She makes a living with artisan crafts, more specifically by making traditional woven fabrics. She started this business when she learned to weave with her parents, and she has 8 years of experience to date.

She has organized a group to apply for a loan, which she will use to buy thread to weave her products. In the very near future, she wants to see her business prosper and to have employees. The other members of the group make a living making traditional woven fabrics and planting vegetables.

In the photo there are eleven women, but this loan will only be granted to ten of them because one did not fulfill the requirements.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 54 years old, married with nine children. She is in the agricultural business, doing hog raising in the Philippines. Margarita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Margarita has been in hog raising for 12 years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Margarita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rex

texts.en:
Rex is 32 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the village of Calabayan Minanga. To help his parents, Rex engaged in a retail business, primarily an 'e-load' business. He has been in this business for two years. 

Right now, Rex is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to purchase 'load wallet' (money transfer via cell phone) and 'sim-cards' to sell. He hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase 'load wallet' and 'sim-cards' to sell in his e-load business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita tiene 37 años,  tiene cuatro hijos de las edades de 12, 10, 8 y 4 años, ella se dedica al comercio de carne en su carnicería que se encuentran en la comunidad de Palcoco,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Margarita va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ganado para el faenado su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere tener carne para la venta, La Sra. Margarita enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay varias carnicerías por la localidad,  pero ella tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad con la que trata a su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de una congeladora grande, su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 37 years old and has four children, ages 4, 8, 10, and 12. She makes a living in the meat trade with her butcher's shop in the community of Palcoco. This loan is her second with the institution. 

Margarita will use this loan to buy livestock to slaughter. Her reason for applying for this loan is that she would like to have meat for sale. Margarita faces some challenges in her business, such as competition, as there are several butchers in her town. However, she has a large clientele thanks to the friendly manner in which she serves her clients. 

She will use the earnings to buy a large freezer. Her wish for her business is to have a stable and profitable business which which she can increase her financial income.

loans.use: to buy livestock to slaughter.

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en:
Johnbosco is 32 years old man and operates a salon from which he earns his main income. He also is a maize farmer. His salon is located in a rural area with insufficient electricity supply thus hindering his business operations. He has a strategy of improving his efficiency and competing with other people in the same business by buying solar power so as to have a constant supply of power.

Johnbosco is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy a solar panel and battery. Inadequate capital and high license fees pose a challenge to his business plans. He hopes to own a modern salon.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel and battery.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. Nora is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Nora requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Nora has been in this business for 12 years now. In the future, Nora would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is 37 years of age and lives in Barumbong. She is married, with three children.

Marlina has a pig-raising business. She earns about PHP 15,000 from the business, every four months. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more pigs. In the future, Marlina hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 43-year-old farmer. He is married and a father of two school-going children. He also operates a transport business to supplement his income. He earns a monthly income of KES. 5,000 which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his third business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. 

He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs i.e. machetes, oxen, and fertilizers. He anticipates to get profits, which he will use to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to own a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs i.e. machetes, oxen, and fertilizers

loans.name: Agustin Obispo

texts.es:
El señor Agustin Obispo es casado, tiene 50 años de edad, de escolaridad 6 años del nivel primario, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia, se dedica a la artesania, especificamente a la tejeduria de Guipiles, inicio este negocio trabajando con su hermano, actualmente tiene 20 años de experiencia.

Solicita un prestamo que le servira para la compra de materia prima para poder elaborar sus tejidos. quiere seguir prosperando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Agustin Obispo is married and is 50 years old.  He completed six years of elementary school and has six children, one of whom is in school.  He works in handicrafts, specifically weaving Guipiles or traditional indigenous dresses and blouses.  He began this business working with his brother, and he currently has 20 years of experience.

He is asking for a loan that will help him to purchase raw material in order to make his woven fabrics.  He wants his business to continue prospering.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda is married and a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling natural medicines in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vitamins to sell for her natural medicines business.

Herminigilda has been in this business for five years. Herminigilda earns more income from clothing sales.

Herminigilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vitamins to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La Sra. Virginia tiene 45 años de edad,  ella se dedica a la venta de papelería, material de escritorio,  libros etc. Ella vende variedad de productos según a la temporada, tiene ubicado su bazar librería en la zona de la 16 de Julio, ella vive en casa familiar, La Sra. Virginia solicita el crédito para proveerse de mercadería con la compra de material escolar para su librería – bazar ya que le va muy bien ya que por la ubicación del negocio tiene una buena venta y es una persona responsable y trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que surtirá su negocio y por ende mejorara sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Virginia is 45 years old and sells paper goods, desk supplies, books, etc.  She sells a variety of products depending on the season.  She has a book shop in the “16 de Julio” zone and lives in a relative’s home.  Virginia is asking for this loan to resupply her shop with school supplies, since things are going well because of her business’ location.  She has good sales and is a responsible, hardworking woman who is grateful for the support her business has gotten from the institution.  She will be able to stock her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 41 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a pig-raising business to sell pigs in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over five years and earns 3,000PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC since year 2011 and now she has requested a loan of 5,000PHP to purchase additional feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for pigs.

loans.name: Jockus

texts.en:
Jockus is a 25-year-old, married man with two children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He is a teacher by profession and he was inspired into service by his desire to inspire young people. Like most government workers, he is challenged by low salary. His desire is to upgrade his studies and build a good residential house for his family. 

Jockus intends to use the loan to buy construction materials, such as bricks and sand .

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as bricks and sand.

loans.name: Rogaciano

texts.en:
Rogaciano is a 42-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He has five children. The eldest is 11 and the youngest is 2 years old. He is engaged in a motorcycle transportation business. He has been in this business for 10 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Rogaciano is requesting a loan to renew his driver's license and pay school fees. Renewing his driver's license is important for him to continue his business without any doubt of being caught. He also wants to pay his children's school fees. With the help of this loan, he will be able to meet his needs and the needs of his children.

In the future, Rogaciano hopes to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renew his driver's license and pay school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beads and thread for her embriodery business

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Loida requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Loida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband have been in the fishing business for more than 12 years now. This is the source of their income.
Arlyn is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and buckets.
In the future, Arlyn hopes to expand their fishing business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and buckets

loans.name: Dionela

texts.es:
Dionela de 22 años de edad,esta casada con Nilton, con quien tiene un hijo de 3 años. Esta familia reside en la casa que Nilton heredó de sus padres.Dionela es una madre joven y todos sus esfuerzos estan en el desarrollo de su familia. Cuenta con 3 terrenos los cuales fueron otorgados por sus suegros y en ellos siembra espinacas, alfalfa, arvejas, orégano, manzanilla y otros.
Gracias a su destreza para los negocios viaja hasta la ciudad de Lima, donde los vende a mejores precios. Dionela, a su corta edad ha experimentado ciertos fracasos o pérdidas, las que se debieron en su mayoría, a la falta de ingresos económicos , pero  con bastante empeño y sacrificio ha logrado adquirir un terreno en el cual empezó a sembrar maíz.Éste es el segundo préstamo con KIVA, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.En estar oportunidad solicita S/1000 soles para la compra de abono orgánico el cual será esparcido en sus sembríos de arvejas y espinacas.
texts.en:
Dionela is 22 years old and married to Nilton, with whom she has a 3 year old son.  They live in the house that Nilton inherited from his parents.  Dionela is a young mother and all of her efforts are in order to develop her family.  She has three fields that she received from her in-laws where she plants spinach, alfalfa, peas, oregano, chamomile, and other crops.  Thanks to her skills at business, she travels to the city of Lima where she sells her harvest for a better price.

Dionela, at her young age, has experienced failures and losses, which were mostly due to her lack of financial resources.  With effort and sacrifice she has succeeded in aquiring land where she can begin to plant corn.  

This is her second loan with Kiva, and she promises to be punctual with her repayments.  She is requesting 1000 soles to purchase fertilizer that will be scattered on her pea and spinach crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more canned goods, bread, snacks, milk, and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Rosedelma

texts.en:
Rosedelma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosedelma is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosedelma has a bakery business in the Philippines. Rosedelma requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, etc. for her bread production business.

Rosedelma has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Rosedelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, etc. for her bread production business

loans.name: Nishtiman

texts.en:
Nishtiman is a 35-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Nishtiman is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Nishtiman has six years of experience with her small, home-based sewing and tailoring activity, making dresses for women and children as well as small fabric household items - anything her customers ask for. She would like to improve her work area, do some renovation work, and decorate it to make it a bit more pleasant, creating an atmosphere where both she and her customers have a nicer time as they engage in the creative process.

To be able to pay for the improvement work, Nishtiman took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 2400 USD.

loans.use: to improve her work area and do some renovation work

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago, tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Lempira junto a su familia. El lleva 14 años de dedicarse a su propio cultivo de café. Produce café pergamino húmedo y seco y lo vende en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es el cuarto ciclo y es por 25,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar  fertilizantes y abonos para darle mantenimiento a la finca de café y mejorar la producción y los ingresos familiares cada año. Su meta es que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en: Santiago, 40, is married and has 4 children.  He lives with his family in a town in the municipality of Lempira.  Santiago has been cultivating his own coffee crops for 14 years. He produces wet-processed and dry-processed parchment (un-hulled) coffee, which he sells in the local market.  He is requesting his 4th loan from ODEF for 25,000 Honduran lempiras, which he will use to buy chemical and organic fertilizers to maintain his coffee crops and increase his coffee farm's production.  This way he can increase his household income each year.  His goal is to provide his children with an education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies for his coffee farm

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer de 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su menor hija, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hija, ya que Maritza es padre y madre para ella; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Maritza no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Maritza trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta crianza y venta de cerdos, adicionalmente en las tardes trabaja vendiendo golosinas en las afueras de un cementerio de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree 	que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Maritza se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de un pequeño corral para sus cerdos y también podrá comprar mayor cantidad de golosinas para surtir su negocio y atender a mas clientes, así pues Maritza seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver convertida a su hija en una profesional.
texts.en:
Maritza is 40 years old and lives in the city of Ica with her youngest daughter, who she loves and is her principal motivation in life.  She is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates her efforts to improving her daughter's life, since Maritza is both father and mother to her.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work since she was very young, Maritza was not able to study nursing, but she would have liked very much to do so.

By her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Martiza works at her small business raising and selling pigs.  Additionally, in the afternoon she works selling snacks on the outskirts of a cemetery in her city.  She works every day for about ten hours and believes that her work is going well due to the kind treatment she provides to her customers.

Martiza is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to construct a small corral for her pigs and also purchase a larger quantity of snacks to stock her store and serve more customers.  Maritza will continue working and making an effort to achieve her dream that her daughter has a professional job.

loans.use: to construct a corral.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 39 years old, married and has six children, three in school. Marissa is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

Marissa has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie, 40, is married, has an 11-year-old son and is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been in the fishing business for 10 years now together with her husband. This is the source of her income. 
Tessie is requesting a loan to buy fish nets, fish hooks, floaters and lead sinkers, materials used for catching fish. With the help of this loan, she will be able to catch many fish and sell it in her local area.
In the future, Tessie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, fish hooks, floaters and lead sinkers

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 63 years old and married with eight children. Teofila works very hard to provide for them.

Teofila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like biscuits, shampoo, oil, sugar and other groceries for her general store.

Teofila has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, biscuits, shampoo, oil, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future, Teofila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like biscuits, shampoo, oil, sugar and other groceries for her general store

loans.name: Byron Tomas

texts.es:
el señor Byron Tomas es soltero tiene 25 años de edad, curso 3 años de educacion secundaria, se dedica a la sastreria, inicio este negocio con el apoyo de su señor padre, actualmente tiene 2 años de experiencia.

solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para ampliar su capital de trabajo, en el futuro no muy lejano el quiere ver su negocio prosperado. También cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.
texts.en: Byron Tomas, 25, is single and finished three years of high school. He is a tailor and started his business with his father's help two years ago. He is applying for a loan to increase his working capital and hopes to see his business prosper soon. He also has his family's support.

loans.use: by providing working capital.

loans.name: Nkoine

texts.en:
Nkoine is 31 years old, married to Lucy and the father of three children. For the last four years, he has farmed his own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He learned about KADET LTD through posters. 

This will be his second loan. He plans to buy farm inputs and hire machinery for preparation of the land. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more wheat for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 41-year-old single mother of four children from Kasese, Uganda. Thirteen years ago after the death of her husband she decided to venture into clothes sales in order to raise school fees for her children. She also practices farming where she grows both cash and food crops. The ever-changing customer preferences and bad weather affect her business growth while her dream is is to own a modern boutique. Mary is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Karina Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Karina sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior credito crecio en su actividad,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como abarrotes por mayor ya que incremento sus ventas.
texts.en: Karina continues selling primary needs products in her neighborhood store.  She says that things went well for her with the previous loan.  Karina continues with her business of selling primary needs products in her neighborhood store.  She says that things went well for her with her previous loan.  This time she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as groceries in volume now that her sales have increased.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.es:
Doña Maria tiene 62 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo en el municipio de Choloma,Cortes.
Doña Maria tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para dama y caballero. Este negocio lo inicio hace 30 años este ha sido su fuente de ingreso que le ha permitido ayudarle a su esposo a solventar los gastos diarios del hogar. comenta que esta oportunidad de financiamiento la han ayudado mucho por las facilidades de pago que otorgan en la Institución. 
Actualmente esta solicitando su préstamo seis de 8,000 lempiras el cual piensa comprar mas mercadería como faldas, pantalones, vestidos, camisas etc. surtiendo su negocio aumentaran las ventas y tendrán mejores ingresos para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
María, 62, is married living with her husband in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.  She has a business selling women’s and men’s clothing.  She started the business 30 years ago and it’s been her source of income that has made it possible for her to help her husband cover daily household expenses.  She comments that this financing opportunity has helped her much because of the easy payment options granted by the institution.

She’s currently asking for an 8,000 Lempira loan to buy more merchandise like skirts, pants, dresses, shirts, etc.  By stocking her business, her sales will increase and her income will improve so she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es: Raúl, tiene 35 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos y vive en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Hace 9 años Raúl decidió por establecer su propio negocio de pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como granos básicos, refrescos, churros, lácteos, carnes, abarrotes y otros. El quiere ofrecer variedad de productos y aumentar la clientela para eso ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de 25,000 lempiras para surtir su negocio. Tiene como plan hacer crecer el negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Raúl, 35, is married and has two children; he lives in the municipality of Masica, Atlántida.  He decided nine years ago to start his own grocery store business to sell basic staples like basic grains, soft-drinks, snacks, dairy products, meats, grocery items and others.  He wants to offer a variety of products and increase his clientele which is why he’s decided to request a 25,000 Lempira loan to stock his store.  His plan is to make the business grow to support his family.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo Jose

texts.es:
Guillermo José de 56 años de edad, casado con un hijo de 19 años, el cual estudia en la Universidad. Guillermo es originario de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país; él se caracteriza por ser una persona responsables, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablente por falta de recursos económicos, no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar  ingeniera automotriz. Por eso lucha día  a día para cumplir su sueño de ver formado a su hijo con una carrera, para que tenga un futuro mejor.
Gracias  a su espíritu y sus  ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de llantas para vehículos  de segunda mano, negocio que lo desempeña  desde hace 10 años, de forma ambulante y por encargo. La rutina de trabajo  de Guillermo es de unas 12 horas diaria, visitando a sus clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra y venta  de llantas de diferentes números como 10-00-20,11-R- 22-5, y llantas numero 9. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. Guillermo José agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Guillermo José, 56, is married and has a 19-year-old son who is in college. Guillermo was born in León in western Nicaragua. He is responsible, hardworking, and wants to succeed. He did not have the money to pay for college, but he would have liked to study automobile engineering. He strives each day to fulfill his dream of seeing his son have a profession and brighter future.

With spirit and the desire to get ahead, he has been selling tires for used cars as a street vendor and by filling customer orders for 10 years. Guillermo works 12 hours a day, visiting regular customers and prospects. Hoping to increase his income, he will use this loan to buy tires of the following model numbers: 10-00-20,11-R- 22-5, and 9.

Guillermo José thanks the Kiva lenders for supporting low-income people living in poorer countries like Nicaragua so that they can have decent work.

loans.use: to buy tires for used cars.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bananas and firewood to sell in the city

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is 39 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Nelda has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.  She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Nelda has been in this business for three years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Freddy Donald

texts.es:
Freddy es un hombre de 29 años, vive en la 32 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Freddy no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica Automotriz, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Cabrito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Freddy trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de arte, él vende diversos cuadros decorativos para el hogar, Freddy trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por la calidad y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Freddy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de cuadros para abastecer su negocio y atender a mas clientes, así pues   Freddy seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio y poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Freddy, 29, is single and lives in the city of Huaraz. He is friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic, and wants to succeed. He would have liked to have studied automobile mechanics, but he didn't have the money, and he needed to help his parents. In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and sometimes prepares a delicious rice with goat meat dish to share with his family. 

On his own and with determination, Freddy manages his small business selling art, specifically decorative frames for the home. Freddy works 10 hours each day and believes the business is prospering because he offers quality products and good customer service.

Freddy thanks the Kiva lenders because their support will allow him to buy wholesale frames to stock his business and service more customers. He will keep working hard to achieve his great dream of expanding his business and gradually getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy decorative frames.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fish to sell in her food stall.

Anita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Anita's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in food stall.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of two school-going children. Mwanakombo runs a food cafe that has been in operation for five years. The family also earns some income from the spouse’s formal employment.

Mwanakombo was introduced to Milango by her friends, and she is asking for a loan of 41,850 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

Despite the high price fluctuations, Mwanakombo believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children, provide a means of income for future and current employees, and also use a part of the money to open a larger cafe.

loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 53 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su madre, a quien agradece todo su apoyo brindado, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Rosa no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libre le gusta cocinar deliciosos postres para compartir con su familia.
Po iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas y tortas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su deliciosa sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de golosinas, como galletas, chocolate, caramelos, dulces y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para abastecer su negocio y atender a mas clientes, así pues Rosa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 53, is single living in Pisco with her mother who she thanks for all the support provided.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and because she had to start work at a very young age, Rosa was unable to study nursing like she would have liked to.  She enjoys cooking desserts in her free time to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Rosa works in a small business selling snacks and cakes.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes she does well because of the tasty way she cooks and the kind way she treats her customers.

Rosa is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she’ll be able to buy snacks like cookies, chocolates, caramels, candy and others that will help her stock her business and tend to more customers so that Rosa can continue working and striving to reach her great dream: to own a house.

loans.use: to buy snacks.

loans.name: Ntopio

texts.en:
Ntopio is 32 years old, married and blessed with two children that he supports. He has been a mixed farmer in the Narok area for the past five years. His monthly income is KES.15,000 and with his second loan of KES. 40,000 from KADET LTD he plans to purchase farm inputs and prepare his garden for crop growing.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business. His future dream is to have a stable business and improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and prepare his garden for crop growing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy plastic for mat-making and selling business

loans.name: David Rafael

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pequeño hijo de 3 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida , él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño; gracias a su esfuerzo David se encontraba estudiando la carrera técnica de Mecánica Automotriz, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar no pudo concluir sus estudios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, gracias al apoyo de su madre, David trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte, adicionalmente tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su hogar, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
David se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la conversión al sistema de gas natural de su taxi, de esta manera David podrá ahorrar, dejando de consumir gasolina, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
David, 33, lives in the city of Pisco with his little three-year-old son who he loves and his main reason for living.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who focuses all his efforts into moving his little one forward.  Thanks to his efforts, David was studying auto mechanics but sadly, due to lack of economic resources and the need to start working, he was unable to continue with his studies but he would have liked to have done so.

With much effort and dedication and thanks to his mother’s support, David works as a taxi driver providing transportation services.  He also has a small grocery store at home.  He works every day for about 12 hours and thinks he does well because of his good prices and the kind way he treats his customers.

David is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to convert his taxi to natural gas which will translate to savings for David when he stops using gasoline.  In this way he will be able to continue striving and working towards reaching his great dream of owning a house.

loans.use: to convert his taxi from gasoline to natural gas.

loans.name: Asthi

texts.en:
Asthi is a 45-year-old Iraqi woman, married and a mother of four children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Asthi is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Asthi has 13 years' experience with the small, home-based sewing and tailoring activity, making dresses for women and children as well as household items made of fabric, based on her clients' orders. She would like to improve her little business. One of her priorities is to purchase a good table as a base for the sewing machine which is currently placed on a large plastic cooler and as she works, she sits on the floor beside it. She would also like to  buy an embroidery machine to improve her creative offers and buy small furniture items to better organize her work and materials.

To be able to pay for these purchases, Asthi took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 1800 USD.

loans.use: to purchase a good base table for the sewing machine, and some additional items for her sewing business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 32 years old and lives in the town of Busia  in the Iganga  region of Uganda. He is married  and has one child. For the past four years, Robert  has been working hard to manage his clothes shop where he sells dresses and pants. 

To help expand his business, Robert  has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand his stock of clothes to sell, and will help Robert  to generate greater profits and boost the business and increase his income. Robert  hopes that in the future he will be able to open a second store. 

Robert  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his stock of clothes of different styles for sale

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 54 years old, married to Jane, with three children. He has been running his motorcycle business and also practices crop farming with the help of his wife.

This is his fourth loan in KADET LTD and he wants to use it to buy farm inputs. He hopes to expand his motorcycle transport and increase his farm produce in order to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cutting firewood to sell in town.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She lives with her family in San Miguel, Bohol. Erlinda earns a living through her food vending business. She sells home-cooked foods to the people in her place. Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, margarine and others. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, margarine and others

loans.name: Droste

texts.en:
Droste is 34 years old and married with five children.  With three children in school, Droste works very hard to provide for them.

Droste runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Droste has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future Droste would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 45 years old and married to Richard who contributes to the family income. She has been running a grocery shop for about four years with an income of KES.15,000 a month.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD and she wants to add more stock of onions and tomatoes to sell. She hopes to be self-reliant and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a farmer in Emali town, also has a retail shop in the area. She used her previous loan to buy fertilizer as well as using part of it for land preparation.

This will be her third loan and she plans to use the amount to pay school fees for her child who is in secondary school and also buy more stock of soft drinks for sale in her shop.

She hopes to grow both her retail and farming businesses, make more income, and be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child and also buy more stock of soft drinks for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is a 42-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She has four children. The eldest is 18 and the youngest is 4 years old. She has operated her 'sari-sari' or variety store business for five years now. This is the source of her income  for the needs of the family.

Benedicta is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and a rice field. She wants to start another business which is farming. With the help of this loan, she will be able to have her own rice field and she can start her second business. This will help her to earn more profit and to supply other needs and demands of the family.

In the future, Benedicta hopes to expand her business and improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a rice field

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 48 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with three of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, David has been working hard to manage his clothes store where he sells dresses and pants. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more  clothes such as shirts to sell and will help David to generate a greater profit and Improve his standard of living. David hopes that in the future, he will be able to boost the business. 

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes such as shirts to sell

loans.name: Rosa Albina

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 26 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus pequeños, ya que ella es madre y padre para ellos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Rosa no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Cosmetología, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra para engreír a sus hijitos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas, ella vende diversas frutas de acuerdo a la estación y trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas, Rosa cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de frutas, como mangos, manzanas, uvas y otras, de esta manera Rosa tendrá mejor abastecido su negocio y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 26 year old woman. She lives in the city of Ica with her two small children who she loves and who are her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who strives to provide for her children since she is both their mother and father. Unfortunately, because of  a lack of financial resources and because she has had to work since she was very young, Rosa was not able to go to school to become a cosmetologist, something that she would have very much liked to do. In her free time, she likes to listen to music and sometimes she likes to spoil her children by making a delicious dish of carapulcra.
On her own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Rosa has a small business selling fruit. She sells different fruits depending on the season and works about 8 hours every day. Rosa thinks that things are going well because she offers affordable prices and friendly customer service.
Rosa is very grateful for the Kiva micro loans as they have helped her to buy larger quantities and different varieties of fruit such as mangoes, apples, grapes, etc.  She has also been able to stock her business and serve her customers better and therefore, continue working and striving for her biggest dream, owning her own home.

loans.use: purchase fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks, noodles and breads, to resell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine has been a good borrower since she started borrowing financial services from lenders. Josephine is 47 years of age. She lives with her live-in partner and two children. She started selling bananas, vegetables and ingredients in the year 1990. She is thankful because through her hard work, determination and patience, she was able to increase her sales and profit. Now she wants to have a continuous smooth flow of her business. That’s the reason she is asking for another loan of PHP 40,000. She will use this loan to buy stocks of banana, baguio beans, sayote(chayote), onion, ginger and garlic for her fruit and vegetable business. She hopes that her requested loan amount will be granted so she can educate her two children, improve her financial stability and have a better way of living someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks of banana, baguio beans, sayote (chayote), onion, ginger and garlic for her fruit and vegetable business

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja is 32 years old. He lives in Chkhorotsku District with his 28-year-old wife Mariam and his retired mother. Elguja requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The family owns a vineyard and an agricultural plot of land where nut trees are grown. Also Elguja plows land himself and then sows different kinds of vegetables. He uses the grapes to make wine and it’s sold with the harvested produce locally at the markets.  According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Elguja requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Elguja will rent a workshop and purchase a joiner’s bench for processing laminate flooring and wood. Elguja used to work as an artisan and he has a good experience in this sphere. As laminate flooring has grown significantly in popularity, perhaps because it may be easier to install and maintain than more traditional surfaces such as hardwood flooring, Elguja will have a lot of private orders among his villagers. He will use the profit to develop his business and in future open his own workshop.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will give Elguja chance to be successful and provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a joiner’s bench for processing laminate flooring and wood.

loans.name: Murtaz

texts.en:
Murtaz is 37 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and mother in Senaki District. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Murtaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Murtaz has a grocery store near his house. He purchases the stock of groceries at wholesale prices and then resells them in his grocery store with a price markup. He has a rich experience in his business and works hard to improve living conditions for his family. But the income is too small and the family remain in a poor category.

His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Murtaz will purchase a coffee grinder machine. He will place this coffee grinder machine in his grocery store. With a small part of the loan Murtaz will buy a variety of coffee beans to grind for his customers. This will increase the income of the family.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a coffee grinder machine

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio is a 46-year-old married man and a father of five children. He is a rice farmer and has been in the business for more than three years now. 

Eugenio is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farm and eventually his harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her food production business.

Leonila successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to continue her grocery store and food businesses.

NWTF is listing Leonila's business profile for a new loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her food production business.

loans.name: Jorge Jean Pierre

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Jorge se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz a la Cubana para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jorge trabaja como auxiliar de encomiendas, en una empresa de transportes de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindad podrá realizar la compra de una laptop, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder realizar sus trabajos académicos y mejorar sus métodos de estudios, así pues Jorge seguirá trabajando y estudiando para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional y poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 19-year-old, single young man.  He lives in the city of Pisco with his parents and siblings.  He is very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic.  He has a great desire to improve himself.  Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Jorge is studying to be a systems engineer.  In his free time he likes to play sports and sometimes he cooks a great dish, Cuban Rice, to share with his family.

Due to his own initiative, a lot of effort and dedication, Jorge works as an assistant at a transportation company in his city.  He works every day for about 8 hours and he believes that it is going well for him due to his good performance and the way he treats others in a friendly way.

Jorge is very grateful for Kiva loans, since thanks to the help that is offered, he will be able to buy a laptop which will help him greatly to carry out his schoolwork and improve his study methods.  In this way, Jorge will continue to work and study with the end of accomplishing his great dream of becoming a professional and little by little get ahead in life.

loans.use: buy a laptop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beads, thread, and other materials for her embroidery business

loans.name: Mayimuna

texts.en:
Mayimuna is 38 years old and  resides in one of the city surburbs.  She has four children, three of whom attend school. Mayimuna works  in a hair salon  which she started in 2008 so that she could meet her daily household expenses.She started this business when her  husband, who was the family breadwinner, passed away and she had no source of income. She looked at ladies' quest for beauty as an opportunity to help her put food on the table.

 Mayimuna's customers are mostly ladies around the area. She received a school fees loan of 1,000,000 UGX for tuition for her children. Her major challenge is inadequate capital for expanding her business.

Mayimuna's dream is to see all her children finish school well so that they can have a better life in future.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 56 years old, married, and supports a family of five; his spouse assists him in producing additional income. Stephen is a small-scale farmer and owns a retail shop. He has been in business for the last 23 years. From this business he gets an average income of KES.30,000 a month. 

Stephen as borrowed a loan of KES. 100,000 of which he intends to use to purchase stock of wheat flour and washing detergents for his retail shop as well as purchasing farm inputs.

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business as well as diversify his business venture to acquire wealth. His dream and hope is to be a well-accomplished businessman and that he will be able to give the best education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy wood.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a responsible mother who lives at Solana, with her spouse and three school-aged children. Remedios runs a store to acquire income, for the daily allowance (a school fee) of her children. She sells grocery items to the people in her village and earns about PHP 8,000 each month.

She hopes to increase her sales. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, breads, noodles and soap to resell. This will help increase her sales capacity.

Remedios hopes to keep gaining good profits, to attain income stability for her family someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, breads, noodles and soap to resell

loans.name: Katherine Maryuri Vanes

texts.es:
Katherine es una mujer de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz con su pequeño hijo de 3 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que ella es madre y padre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Katherine no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Katherine trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Katherine se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una vitrina y abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, bebidas y otros, de esta manera Katherine tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Katherine is a 27-year-old woman and lives in the city of Huaraz with her young, 3-year-old son who she loves and is her main reason for living.  She is very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic.  She dedicates all of her efforts to the progress of her son, since she is his mother and father.

Unfortunately, she wasn't able to study her desired career, law, due to a lack of financial resources and having to work.  She would have liked very much to have studied.  In her free time, she likes to listen to music and sometimes she cooks a delicious dish, ceviche, to share with her family.

Due to her own initiative, great effort, and dedication, Katherine works at a small business selling groceries.  She works every day for about 10 hours and she believes that it is going well for her due to the good prices she offers and the friendly service that she offers her customers.

Katherine is very grateful for Kiva loans, since thanks to the help offered, she will be able to buy a display case and groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, soups, drinks, etc.  In this way, Katherine will better stock her business and will be able to have more customers.  In this way, she will continue working and striving to accomplish her biggest dream of having her own house.

loans.use: buy a display case and groceries.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a hard-working mother who lives at Solana. She is married and has a young child. She has a small store selling grocery items to the people in her village. She has managed her store for over three years now. She hopes to increase her income. That is why she is asking for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, biscuits, sugar, milk and shampoo to sell.

Tessie hopes to keep improving sales as well as improve her friendly approach to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, sugar, milk and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Vahed

texts.en:
Vahed is an experienced, much-respected Iraqi man.  He is 40 years old, married, and a father of 4 children.

Vahed has a small, middle-eastern style fast food sandwich shop where he makes two main kinds of sandwiches:  falafel (a deep-fried ball or patty made from ground chickpeas and fava beans), and meat buns.  Both come with a variety of vegetables and side salads.  Just approaching the shop, one can almost bite the air filled with the succulent smells, creating a great appetite.

Vahed has been running the small restaurant for 5 years.  He is now taking a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 2,000 USD to invest in improvements.
