Elizabeth is married and has one child.  She lives at her parents' house in the Corpaputo community in the town of Achacachi.
Elizabeth studied up to primary school level and now makes a living producing milk in the community.
She needs this loan to buy a dairy cow so as to improve production.
Elizabeth's dream is to have a continuous and stable production of milk.
This is the first time Elizabeth has applied for a loan from Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and improve her income.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Cochi Lipe en la localidad de Achacachi.
El estudio hasta el nivel de Secundaria y actualmente se dedica a la producción de leche en su comunidad.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar un par de vacas lecheras y así mejorar su producción lechera y por ende, sus ingresos.
El sueño de Javier es tener una producción de leche continua y segura para poder mantener a su familia.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Javier is married and has two children.  He lives in his own house, which is in the Cochin Lipe community in the town of Achacachi.
He studied up to secondary school level and currently makes a living producing milk in his community.
He needs this loan to buy a couple of dairy cows so as to improve production and, consequently, his income.
Javier's dream is to have continuous and stable production of milk so he can maintain his family.
This is the second time Javier has applied for a loan from Impro, and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a couple of dairy cows to increase milk production.

loans.name: Maria Pia

texts.es:
María es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, María se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta bailar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, María trabaja como asistente en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 9 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder realizar sus prácticas académicas y mejorar sus métodos de estudios, así pues María seguirá trabajando y estudiando para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional y así poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
María, 19, is single and lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings.  She is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person with a great desire to prosper.  Thanks to her efforts and help from her parents, Marís is earning a degree in Business Administration.  In her free time, she enjoys dancing and sometimes cooking a delicious chicken and rice dish to share with family.

On her own initiative, and through much work and dedication, María works as an assistant at a company in the city.  She works an average nine hours every day and believes that things are going well for her because of her good performance and kindness toward others

María is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy a computer.  This will help her carry out her academic tasks and improve her study methods, allowing her to work and study in order to become a good professional and get ahead, little by litte.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias es separado y tiene dos hijos uno de ellos esta en etapa universitaria, viven en casa en alquiler, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Esperanza de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente  es empleado público; los días domingos el vende zapatos de cholita en una de las  la ferias de la ciudad de El Alto; así cubre los gastos familiares.
El crédito lo requiere para  adquirir más zapatos de tal manera que su capital de trabajo aumentará y también sus ingresos por las ventas.
El sueño de Elias es convertirse en un distribuidor a nivel nacional.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elías is divorced and has two children, one of whom studies at the university.  They live in a rented house in the residential area of Villa Esperanza in the city of El Alto.

He received a high school education and is a public employee.  On Sundays, he sells regional style shoes at the fairs in El Alto to help cover household expenses.  The loan he is requesting is to buy more shoes to increase his working capital and income.  Elías wants to become a national distributor.

This is his third loan through IMPRO and first from KIVA.

loans.use: To buy more regional style "cholita" shoes to sell and increase his income.

loans.name: Magdonal

texts.es: Magdonal, tiene la edad 43 de  años, está casado y vive con la esposa y tres hijos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra  de cerdos. Lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus padres y crecer con el proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Magdonal, 43, is married and lives with his wife and three children.  He is requesting a loan to buy pigs and wants to give them concentrated feed to speed up their fattening.  Once they reach their ideal weight will sell them at the local market or nearby villages.  His aim is to generate more income for his and his parents' welfare, and expand in the pig raising business.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never had a state bank loan and FUDECOSUR is giving him better loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa, de 22 años de edad, esta casada con Ricardo quien es comerciante y padre de su hija de 2 años de edad. Juntos habitan la casa de su suegra.La actividad que realiza Melissa es la venta de productos variados como víveres, utensilios,ropa entre otros. Todos estos productos los compra al por mayor en los centros comerciales y los vende a los comerciantes de su localidad, brindado créditos de pago mínimo diario. Se inició en éste negocio por iniciativa de su suegra quien le brindó el capital y su cartera de clientes. Tiene más de 02 años dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento lo continúa haciendo sola.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos y puede contar con una ocupación, que le permite sentirse productiva, deseando asi convertirse en una prospera empresaria. Por tanto, tiene planes de abrir un puesto de ventas en la casa de su suegra y exhibir su mercadería variada.Este será el préstamo número 04 con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.Con el monto solicitado de  S/.2500 nuevos soles, comprará mercadería variada para tener productos disponibles para sus clientes como balones de gas, platos , entre otros.
texts.en:
Twenty-two year old Melissa is married to Ricardo, a shopkeeper and the father of her two year old daughter.  They live together in Melissa's mother-in-law's house.  Melissa makes a living selling various products such as provisions, utensils and clothes.  She buys all these products in bulk from the shopping centres and then sells them to local businessmen, who pay in daily installments.  Melissa started this business with help from her mother-in-law who provided capital and a customer log.  She has now been doing this work for over two years and, for now, she continues to work alone.

Melissa likes the business as it generates an income and it gives her a profession, making her feel productive. She would like to become a prosperous businesswoman and with this in mind, she has plans to open a shop in her mother-in-law's house where she will be able to display her products.  This will be Melissa's fourth loan with Kiva and she is hoping for help so she can continue working towards her objectives.  With the loan of 2500 Nuevo Soles she will buy various products, such as gas and dishes so that they are available for her customers.

loans.use: to buy products for the home.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, tiene la edad 55 de  años, está casado y vive con la esposa. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra  de una moto. Lo que pretende realizar la compra de la moto para poder transportarse a la propiedad donde tiene unos novillos ya que la propiedad está bastante lejos de la casa como para ir caminando. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar y crecer con el proyecto de cría de novillos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos, 55, is married and lives together with his wife. With this loan, he plans to buy a motorcycle in order to travel more easily to a piece of land where he raises cattle, located too far away to go walking.

Carlos wants his animals to reach a good weight in order to sell them in the local market or in neighboring regions. He wants to make good profits with this activity and increase his wellbeing. 

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had a loan before with a state-owned bank, but FUDECOSUR has granted him the loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to go to work.

loans.name: Mirsa Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Mirsa, muy trabajadora a diario busca como salir adelante con su pequeño negocio la venta de cosméticos y ropa para garantizar el desarrollo de sus dos gemelos quienes ya son unos adolecentes, su esposo le apoya con los gastos del hogar con sus ingresos como conductor de cabezales, ella solicita el crédito para invertir nuevamente en el negocio, en esta ocasión necesita comprar variedad de ropa interior y escolar, para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y poco a poco ir mejorando su nivel de vida con la familia.
texts.en: Mirsa works very hard and every day she is looking to move forward with her small business that sells make-up and clothes so that she can ensure that her teenage twin sons can do well.  Mirsa's husband supports her with household costs, with his income from working as a driver.  Mirsa is applying for a loan to invest again in the business.  On this occasion she need to buy a variety of school uniforms and underwear to cover demand and, little by little, to improve her living conditions with her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of school uniforms and underwear.

loans.name: Herminia Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Herminia Carolina es casada, tiene 35 años de edad, de escolaridad nivel primario, tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales 3 estudian, ella se dedica al comercio, especificamente a la compra y venta de flores para decoraciones, inicio su negocio ayudando a su madre a vender flores, en la actualidad lleva 8 años de experiencia en dicho negocio.

Solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de flores para ampliar su negocio y en el futuro quiere ver su negocio prosperado y tener mas puntos de ventas. Tambien cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien tambien es comerciante.
texts.en:
Herminia Carolina is married.  She is 35 years old and completed primary school.  She has four children, three of whom are studying.  Herminia has a business buying and selling flowers for decoration.  She started her business by helping her mother to sell flowers and she now has eight years experience with this business.

She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy flowers to expand her business. In the future she wants the business to prosper and have more sales outlets.  Herminia receives support from her husband who also has a business.

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: Maria De Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Maria de Rosario es casada, de 39 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian, ella se dedica a la sastreria, inicio su negocio trabajando con su tio, actualmente lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de una maquina plana para coser, en el futuro cercano ella quiere ver su negocio prosperado y tener trabajadores. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es albañil.
texts.en:
Maria de Rosario is married. She is 39 years old and has six years of primary education. She has 7 children and 3 of them are in school. She is a seamstress and started her business by working with her uncle. Now she has 3 years of experience. 

She is asking for a loan that she will use to buy a flat sewing machine. In the near future, she wants to see her business prosper and have employees. She has the support of her husband, who is a bricklayer.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Dona Maria Francisca, Reside en Colonia El Sol en el departamento de Chalatenango al norte del Pais, junto a su esposo de 59 años y sus  hijas que aun estudian (29, 22 y 16 años) y que le ayudan en su actividad de pezca y comercializacion de la misma. La actividad la realiza en una canoa de su propiedad y luego vende su pezca en la zona de residencia y cantones aledaños. Ella solicita el credito para la compra de transmayos (redes para la pezca) y otros insumos necesarios para realizar la actividad.
texts.en: Maria Francisca lives in Colonia El Sol in the department of Chalatenango in the northern part of the country. She lives with her husband, who is 59, and their daughters, aged 29, 22 and 16. They help her in her fishing and fish selling. She does her activity from a canoe that she owns and later she sells her catch in the area where she lives and in nearby communities. She is asking for the loan to buy fishing nets and other materials she need to do her activity.

loans.use: to buy nets and different species of fish.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Don Miguel de 47 años de edad, vive solo con su compañera de vida y se dedican a la venta de minutas desde hace mas de 27 años, en la zona turistica del muelle del Puerto ubicado en el departamento de la Libertad.Son personas reconocidas por ser muy laboriosas.
Necesita su prestamo para comprar los insumos para la elaboracion de minutas (raspadura de hielo, saborizadas con jarabes, limòn o chile, y con un aderezo de jalea de tamarindo, banano o fresa) que son consumen en lugares de clima caluroso, en barquillos o en vasos.
texts.en:
Miguel is 47 years old. He lives alone with his life companion and they have sold snow cones for more than 27 years in the tourist area of the pier in of the port in the department of La Libertad. They are people who are known for being hard working. 

She needs a loan to buy materials to make snow cones that are flavored with syrups, lemon or chiles, and with a topping of tamarind, bananas or strawberry jam. They are consumed in places with warm climates in cones or in cups.

loans.use: raw materials to make snow cones.

loans.name: Celenia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Selenia, es soltera sus cuatro hijos son independientes y casados, recibe el apoyo económico de su ex esposo para los gastos del hogar, ella ha salido adelante prestando sus servicios de empleada domestica con esos ingresos paga sus créditos los cuales han sido para mejorar su vivienda. Este decimo crédito solicitado es para hacer un cuarto para ella con mejores condiciones aprovechando el espacio en su terreno, necesita comprar materiales como cemento, bloques, arena, hierro, piedrines.
texts.en:
Doña Celenia is not married. Her four children are independent and married. She receives financial support from her ex-husband for household expenses. She makes a living offering her services as a domestic worker. With this income she pays her loans which she has taken out to improve her house.

This is the tenth loan she has taken out, and is to build a room for her with better conditions, taking advantage of the space on her land. To do this she needs to buy materials such as cement, blocks, sand, iron and paving slabs.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand, iron, paving slabs.

loans.name: Flor De Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ROSAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teodora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papas, venta de comida, venta de chompas, venta de fruta, venta de lazados, trenzado de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teodora es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace ocho años, aprendiendo el oficio de su cuñada, posteriormente decide comprar una máquina de tejer e instaló su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana y máquina doble) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializara a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE ROSAS” communal bank will begin its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Los Andes center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Teodora is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are selling potatoes, selling food, selling sweaters, selling fruit, selling ribbons and weaving blankets.    

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, among them Teodora. She says that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago. joining at the invitation of a consultant from the institute who went to visit her at her home. Right now, she has a business knitting sweaters. She says that she started this business eight years ago, after deciding to buy a knitting machine and setting it up at her house. 
 
The loan she is taking out now is to increase capital by buying wool and a double machine, which she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of La Paz. She will use it to produce and sell to order. This type of work allows her to support her home as much as possible, because she is married and has four children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy wool and a double machine.

loans.name: Xinia

texts.es: Xinia, tiene la edad 37 de  años, está casada y vive con los dos hijos y el esposo. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de concentrado para el engorde de cerdos. Ella cuenta con las instalaciones por lo que quiere comprar cerdos y el concentrado para el mantenimiento de los mismos. Ella quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cerdos de engorde. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Xinia is 37 years old. She is married and lives with her two children and husband. With this loan she wants to buy feed to fatten up her pigs. She has the facilities which is why she wants to buy pigs and feed for them. She wants to have her animals at the ideal weight for selling them at the market in her area or nearby places.

She wants to generate a larger income for her own and her family's wellbeing, and to grow with the project of fattening pigs. This is the first loan she has taken out with FUDECOSUR. She has not previously taken out any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy feed and pigs.

loans.name: Seenimi Group

texts.fr:
Mme A.SAFIATA CNIHISSIPOMG est responsable du groupe SEENIMI.  Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins âgés à 12 ans.  02 vont à l’école  et  elle a 02 personnes en charge. 
Mme fait la restauration et vend aussi l’eau glacée depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de riz, 01 sachet d’atiéké (couscous de manioc, 01 bidon d’huile et une rangée de bois de chauffe. 
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son restaurant. Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
A. Safiata Cnihissipomg is the leader of the Seenimi group. She is married and the mother of 4 children. The eldest child is 26 years old and the youngest, 12. Two of her children go to school and she has 2 more dependents.

Safiata has a restaurant business and has also been selling iced water for 3 years. She gets her supplies at her local market. Her customers are men and women. She would like to buy 2 bags of rice, 1 packet of "atiéké" (cassava-based couscous), 1 can of oil and a row of firewood. She would like to save her profits so that she can strengthen her restaurant business. She aims to expand her business and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of rice, 1 packet of "atiéké", 1 can of oil and a row of firewood.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 57 years old and a business lady. She is a widowed mother of three. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the past 35 years with a monthly income of about KES 50,000, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her second loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET client. 

The client will use the loan to buy secondhand shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts to sell. She intends to plow the anticipated income back into the business. Beatrice’s hopes and dreams are to expand her clothes selling business and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy secondhand shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, margi, salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en: Jannet is a 34-year-old woman from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Jannet started selling lights in February, 2012, and she has sold 80 lights to date, providing clean energy to 400 people. She is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Miri

texts.en:
Miri is 51 years old. He is married and lives in Gardabani District with his wife, son and daughter-in-law. Miri requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the small wage earned by Miri working as a guard man. He makes a total of 150 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Miri requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Miri will trade in livestock. He plans to purchase animals at wholesale prices for resale with a price markup. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase animals for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 32-year-old man from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  Emmanuel started selling lights in July, 2012, and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is a 38-year-old married man and a father of two children. They live in San Miguel, Bohol. He has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business for more than 8 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Vicente is asking for a loan to buy spare parts like tires, nuts, bolts and fuel for the motorcycle. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of the vehicle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like tires, nuts, bolts and fuel for the motorcycle.

loans.name: M. Rose's Group

texts.fr:
Josette fait partie du groupe  Tujimbere et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 21 ans et  est mariée à Yves, un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 6 mois.

Elle fait le commerce de la bière  depuis  5 ans. 

Elle est à son  troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  bière  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Avec les gains de son commerce, elle parvient à gagner sa vie en satisfaisant les besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Josette is a member of the Tujimbere group and lives in Gitega. She is 21 years old and married to Yves, a builder. The couple have a 6-month-old child. Josette has been selling beer for 5 years. This is her 3rd loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and allow her to buy a large quantity of beer for resale, so that she can earn more money. She manages to earn a living and satisfy the needs of her family using the profits generated by her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beer for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hair chemicals, hair oils, weaves and hair extensions.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa has run her business in her home for 6 years. She sells a variety of soups every day. She starts working at 5 am, going out to the store to buy soup ingredients. She starts selling her dishes at 11:30 am and goes till 3:00 pm. She is a married mother of four. Her children attend school and she works very hard to get ahead and provide them with the best nutrition. Mejumaa started her business with her own savings. 

She has been able to improve her home with the help of her husband, who is a businessman. Between the two of them they have been able to fix up the home. Mejumaa is requesting this loan in order to make improvements to her home where she has her business. 

She is very grateful for the loans, because she has known how to invest them. She has been improving her home with great hard work, bit by bit. She is a young woman who enjoys working and has a great desire to succeed.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to make improvements to her home restaurant.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 66 years old, widowed, and a mother of six children that she supports. She has run a retail shop for the last seven years, getting a monthly income of about KES 20,000. 

She has applied for a third loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, and she plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products.

The anticipated profits will be plowed back into her business for expansion. Her dream is to raise a well-educated family.

loans.use: to restock her retail shop with a variety of consumable products.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en: Luvuno is a clothes merchant. She lives with her husband and two children. She sells from place to place around the city, having learned from a girlfriend, and she has 6 years’ experience. She’s asking for a loan to buy children’s and adults’ clothes like blouses, suits and pants. This loan will help her increase her inventory to be able to earn more income, since the season of highest demand is near. Her goal is to strengthen the business more, offering her family better living conditions by means of her work.

loans.use: to buy children’s and adults’ clothes like blouses, suits and pants.

loans.name: Rhitah

texts.en:
Rhitah is married with four children and three of her children go to school. She has no additional family members.

She sells charcoal and green bananas at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 4 years. She sells to all categories of people, but on a retail basis, for six days a week. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and high transportation costs.

She aspires to building rental houses and also owning a delivery van to ease in transportation.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Development I Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Development I” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Salaymatu.  Salaymatu is age 32. She was born in Bo city in southern Sierra Leone, but she is currently residing in Koidu, together with her husband and  4 children. Her husband is a driver and 2 of her children are attending primary school.

For 6 years now, Salaymatu has been selling cooked rice. With this loan, she will buy cooking ingredients like rice, palm oil (the country's most popular cooking oil), tomatoes, fish, etc., in bulk. This will enable Salaymatu to produce a larger quantity of cooked rice with delicious sauce for sale.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, tomatoes, fish, etc., in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Assunta

texts.en:
Assunta is 50 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 17 years, Assunta has been working hard to manage her drug shop/pharmacy, which sells medicine. 

To help expand her business, Assunta has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase and stock more drugs to sell, and will help her to generate greater profits, expand the business and afford medical expenses. She hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her working capital. 

Assunta is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Assunta who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase and stock more drugs to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been working selling fresh chicken since 2009. He is well known in the region because of his good reputation and good quality of products provided.

Ali is applying for his second loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business capital through increasing the number of chickens available at his shop, in addition to registering his business car and getting a special driving license. This will all help his business grow more and more, and will develop his family's social and financial living.

Ali hopes to provide his family with the best education and living ever. He will keep on improving everything around him to make sure that a wider future is expecting him.

loans.use: to increase his business capital through increasing the number of chickens available at his shop

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is still in the business of selling vehicle spare parts. He has been doing this business for the last seven years and the business is doing well. This marks his third loan from KADET LTD after he successfully cleared his previous loans.

Owing to the financial boost he received from KADET LTD, his monthly income has risen to 25,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

He plans to use the loan to purchase vehicle spare parts to expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase more vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store and bar.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 34 years old, windowed and the mother of five children that she supports. She has run a small food cafe in Bomet market for the last two years, getting a monthly income of 12,000 KES. She learned about KADET LTD from some women in the market who are already registered with KADET LTD.

She has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES which she will use to pay the casual workers at her cafe and also to buy one sack of sugar for use in the cafe.

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into the business for expansion. Her future dream is to own a big hotel.

loans.use: to pay the casual workers at her cafe and also to buy one sack of sugar for use in the cafe

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and agricultural medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La  Sra. Josefa tiene 30 años, casada tiene cinco  hijos de las edades de 15, 12, 10,  9 y 4 todos  se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a tejido de polainas, chompas de niños, bebes y mantas  para las mujeres de pollera, tiene su taller en la comunidad de Oquetiti, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La  Sra. Josefa va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana por mayor para el tejido de sus polainas y chompas ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, La  Sra. Josefa enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor sus materiales para el tejido de sus polainas y chompas.
texts.en:
Josefa is 30 years old and married with five children, who are aged 15, 12, 10, 9 and 4. All of them are school-aged. She works knitting leg warmers, sweaters for children and babies, and shawls for women who wear "polleras" (traditional multilayered skirts). 

Her workshop is in the town of Oquetiti. This loan is her first with the institution. Josefa will use the loan to buy yarn wholesale to knit her leg warmers and sweaters. At this time she already has a lot of sales. She also delivers orders to different markets in the city of El Alto.

The reason she is applying for this loan is to increase her working capital. The challenge that Josefa faces in her business is stocking her merchandise, so she will use her profits and continue to buy supplies wholesale for knitting her leg warmers and sweaters.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Reyes

texts.es:
Don Reyes, tiene 46 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos y vive en el municipio de Morazan,Yoro.
El señor Reyes se dedica a la agricultura hace 15 años, tiene un terreno en donde se ha dedicado a sembrar café, maíz y frijoles porque la zona es apta para estos cultivos, el vende en el mercado local, dice que este negocio es rentable ya que los productos que el vende son de primera necesidad para las familias.  
Es su primer préstamo con Odef por la cantidad de 12000 lempiras, y lo necesita para compra de abono para darle el mantenimiento necesario que requiere el cultivo. espera que con esta inversión pueda obtener una mejor cosecha.
su meta es seguir trabajando con el mantenimiento del cultivo para que sus productos se vendan favorablemente y así ofrecer mejor solvencia económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Reyes, age 46, is married and has 6 children.  He lives in the Morazan municipality in Yoro.

Reyes has been farming for 15 years.  He has land where he grows coffee, corn, and beans.  The zone is suitable for these crops, and he sells at the local market.  He says that this business is profitable because the products that he sells are basic needs items for families.

This loan for 12,000 lempiras is his first loan from ODEF .  He needs it to buy manure to give his crops the maintenance they need.  He hopes that with this investment he will get a better harvest.

His goal is to continue working with maintaining his crops.  He will do this in order for his crops to sell well.  This way he will make his family more financially solvent.

loans.use: to buy manure for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: Doña Julia obtiene sus ingresos elaborando faldas, camisas, vestidos desde hace varios años. Vive con sus 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 dependen aun de ella porque se encuentran estudiando (22 y 20 años). Desde que inicio con creditos en Integral, se ha observado la mejora de su empresita, ya que cuenta con una maquina de coser adicional, y ha contratado a una persona por comision por prenda elaborada, para poder atender a su clientela, que le demanda trabajos por su buena calidad. Ella esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas tela y asi producir prendas y ofertarlas a su clientela.
texts.en:
For several years, Julia has been earning her income by manufacturing skirts, shirts and dresses. She lives with her 4 children, 2 of whom still depend on her because they are studying (ages 22 and 20). Since she started working with Integral loans, her small business has improved; it now has an additional sewing machine and she has hired a person on a commission basis, paid per piece of clothing, so she can meet the demands of her customers, who order from her due to her quality work.
She is asking for this loan to purchase more fabric in order to manufacture garments to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to manufacture garments

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 27 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. For the past three years, Alex has been working hard to manage his bar and restaurant.

To help expand his business, Alex has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more beer and wine to sell. This will help generate greater profits and lead to expansion of the bar. Alex hopes that in the future he will be able to start another business.

Alex is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alex who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more beer and wine to sell.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en: Kassim has requested another Kiva loan from Kiva lenders, via Yehu Microfinance Trust, in order to purchase 50 sacks of charcoal for resale. With the profit from the loan, Kassim will satisfy his family's basic needs and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy 50 sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is married with seven children; only three children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling yellow bananas (Cavendish). She has applied for a loan from MCDTSACCO to buy more bunches of yellow bananas.  She has been in this business for 10 years, selling to all categories of people on a wholesale basis. She works at the market seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges includes thieve and seasonality. She is aspiring to educate her children up to university and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of yellow bananas.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old, married to Beatrice, and a father of five children aged 14, 11, 7, 4 and 1. He has been running a butcher shop for the last four years, getting a monthly income of 20,000 KES. He learned about KADET LTD from one of his regular customers who is a registered member.

He has applied for a second loan of 30,000 KES after successfully paying off his previous loan.

He will use the loan to add stocks of meat to sell in his butcher shop.

The anticipated profits will be reinvested in his business for expansion. His future dream is to rear his own livestock so as to minimize the cost of production.

loans.use: to add stocks of meat to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en:
Jacklyne is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business farming and selling vegetables in Likoni, Mombasa. She has been in this business for 4 years and earns additional income from selling food. Jacklyne is borrowing 15,000 KES through Yehu Microfinance Trust to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Jacklyne has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 45 years old and married to a businesswoman. He is the father of six children between the ages of 3 and 18 years old. He is a livestock trader in the Bomet area and has been running his business for the past two years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000

Joseph learned about KADET LTD through a poster that was set up in the township. He has been advanced his first loan of KES 5,000 from KADET. He intends to use the loan to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profits will be reinvested into his business. His future dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy livestock for trade.

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es:
Doña Marta tiene 46 años, es casada y vive con su esposo en una colonia de la ciudad de Choloma, Cortes.
Marta laboraba en una maquila, pero hace 7 años emprendió un negocio de venta de comida, este negocio esta ubicado en un sector céntrico de la ciudad donde la afluencia de personas es permanente. ofrece variedad de comidas(platos fuerte y golosinas), al gusto de los clientes, eso le ha permitido crecer en su negocio.
como toda una persona emprendedora para poder seguir trabajando, solicito a Odef un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 lempiras que lo necesita para comprar los insumos necesarios para elaborar los alimentos y compra de bebidas.haciendo esta inversión podrá atender mejor sus clientes.
Su sueño es que su negocio pueda crecer mas en clientes, también hacerlo mas grande para dar una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Marta is 46 years old and married.  She lives with her husband in a neighborhood in the city of Choloma, Cortes.

Marta used to work in a factory.  However, seven years ago she undertook a business of selling food.  This business is centrally located in the city where there is a constant influx of people.  She offers a variety of food (main courses and sweets) according to her customers’ preferences.  This has allowed her to grow in her business.

As a completely enterprising person, in order to continue working, she requested a loan for 15,000 lempiras from ODEF.  She needs the loan to buy the supplies needed to make the food and to buy drinks.  By making this investment she will be able to better tend to her customers.

Her dream is for her business to be able to get more customers.  She also wants to make it bigger in order to make it more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food to sell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 38 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Hussein has been working hard to manage his brick-laying business. 

To help expand his business, Hussein has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to pay some of his workers and to buy other materials for brick laying. This will help Hussein to generate greater profits and enable him to better run the business. Hussein hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children. 

Hussein is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs such as Hussein who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to pay some of his workers and buy other materials for brick-laying.

loans.name: Freeda

texts.en:
Ms. Freeda is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has owned a beauty parlor business for seven years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeovers, hair-styling and facials. Through her excellent work, she has become well-known in her area. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, Freeda is interested in buying more cosmetic products for the parlor.  However, because she has a low amount of cash on hand, she contacted the Kashf Foundation to apply for her second loan. 

Freeda needs a loan of PKR 10,000 to buy bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities as well as packs of hair rollers. She hopes to cater to more customers and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities along with packs of hair rollers.

loans.name: Jedida

texts.en:
Jedida, from Nyahururu, is 37 years old and is married to James. They have four children who are in school.

For the past seven years, Jedida has been in a grocery business and also practices crop farming.

She has applied for her second loan from Kadet Ltd. after paying her previous loan well. 

She hopes to use the loan amount to purchase stock for the grocery and to buy fertilizer and seedlings. She hopes to expand her business and use modern farming methods in the near future.

loans.use: To buy stock for her grocery and also fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Adeeba

texts.en:
Adeeba is a 47-year-old woman and a mother of three. 

She has been running a business of bed sheets sales for many years. She purchases a variety of bedclothes and bed covers from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. By now, she has become famous for selling good quality items in her community. 

Adeeba requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of bed sheets and covers in different colors and designs, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

Currently she is in her fifth loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of bed sheets and covers in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 31 years old, a married woman and a mother of two children. 

She has been running a general store for the past five years. She is eager to support her husband financially to provide a better future to her children. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to make her store fully stocked, she needs to purchase stock of rice, flour and grains. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. 

She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of the income on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, flour and grains.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 30 years old, single and supports one child. 

She has run a beauty salon for the last seven years, making a monthly income of KES 34,000. 

She applied for a third loan of KES 40,000 from KADET Ltd., with which she plans to get an additional hair drier for her salon. 

The anticipated profits will help expand the business. Her future dreams is to buy a residential plot.

loans.use: To purchase another hair drier for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Ms. Kaneez is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is motivated to provide all facilities for life to her family. She has been running a general store business with the support of her husband for the past twenty-five years. The man shown in the photo is Kaneez’s husband. They are happily doing it together to meet the needs of their children and have attained a regular list of customers. To make their store fully stocked, Kaneez requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase rice, flour, and grains. This way they will be able to cater to more customers time after time. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, flour, and grains

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe existe depuis le 07 /07/2011 date de création du Banc Villageois Nimzatt sagatta .il est composé de 30 femmes toutes issues du village avec des liens de parenté et d'amitié trés proche.

La représentante du groupe, Awa,est une femme célibataire de 30 ans sans enfant. Elle s'active dans l'élevage de moutons et la vente de friandises au marché de Keur Momar  et à l'école du village.
Sur la photo elle est debout à droite avec la main levée .

Avec le financement reçu, elle espère pouvoir acheter 2 moutons pour faire de l'élevage d'embouche pour ensuite les revendre sur pieds.
Avec les bénéfices obtenus elle souhaite atteindre un niveau d'épargne qui lui permettra de bénéficier d'un prêt d'un montant supérieur.
texts.en: This group was formed on the 7th of July, 2011, the same day that the Nimzatt Sagatta "banc villageois" was created. It is made up of 30 women who all come from the same village and enjoy close bonds of family and friendship. The group's representative, Awa, is 30 years old, single and has no children. She breeds sheep and sells sweets at the Keur Momar market and the village school. She is the one standing on the far right of the picture with her hand raised. She hopes to use her loan to buy 2 sheep, so that she can fatten them up and then resell them. She would like to use the profits she makes to build up a certain level of savings that would allow her to benefit from a higher loan.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: El Sr. Bernardo  tiene 58 años, casado con tres hijos que tienen las edades de 25, 20 y 16 años,  el se dedica  a la venta de leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, el vive en la localidad de Batallas,  la gente de la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Bernardo  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de una vaca lechera y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,    ya que le proporcionara  buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos, El Sr. Bernardo  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  también el clima ya que se levanta a tempranas horas de la mañana para ordeñar a sus vacas, en esta actividad le ayudan sus hijos, trabaja toda la familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Bernardo, 58, is married and has three children aged 25, 20 and 16. He lives in the municipality of Batallas, where people work in agriculture and raise livestock. He has dairy cattle and sells milk.

This is Bernardo’s first loan with the institution; he will use it to buy a milk cow. He wants to make use of this opportunity to increase his milk production and have a better income.

Bernardo faces different challenges in his business. For example, he needs to buy fodder every once in a while. Weather conditions are also a challenge for him, since he wakes up early in the morning to milk the cows, helped by his children; the whole family is involved in this activity.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 37-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk sales with her husband for 12 years. She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors. Shehnaz also makes butter and cheese with this milk and generates extra revenue through sales. Her husband also assists her by selling to door to door. 

She feels pleasure while doing this business to secure their children’s future. She is a mother of four daughters and two sons. Two of them are school-going. One of her sons is shown in the photo. 

She needs to earn more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. For the purchase of one more buffalo, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. This would increase production capacity of milk, which would help in growing her sales. She expects a boost in her net income and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Salla's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Khowlaré du banc villageois de Lew Lewal Syer a été créé le 29 février 2010. Il compte 18 femmes.Il est réputé pour sa synergie et sa solidarité interne. L'activité dominante des membres est l'embouche.

La représentante de ce groupe, Salla, est une femme mariée de 33 ans avec 5 enfants dont 3 filles. Elle fait de l'embouche. Elle achète des moutons, les élève et les revend au bout de 05 mois. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite de la photo en boubou rose avec la main levée.

Avec son prêt elle voudrait acheter 10 moutons.

Ses bénéfices serviront à améliorer la situation de vie familiale et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Khowlaré solidarity group belongs to the Lew Lewal Syer "banc villageois" and was created on the 29th of February, 2010. It is made up of 18 women. The group is known for its synergy and internal solidarity. The main business of the group members is livestock fattening.

Salla, the group's representative, is a 33-year-old married woman with 5 children, 3 of whom are girls. She practices livestock fattening. She buys sheep, fattens them up and resells them after 5 months. She is the women standing on the far right of the picture, wearing a pink boubou and raising her hand. She would like to use her loan to buy 10 sheep. Her profits will be used to improve her family's living conditions and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep for fattening.

loans.name: Manantial De San Felipe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANANTIAL DE SAN FELIPE”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Santusa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de coca, tejido de mantas, tejido de guantes, venta de ropa, costura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Santusa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de guantes y chompas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años, aprendiendo por iniciativa propia, y en la actualidad exportan este producto a Europa.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializara a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Manantial de San Felipe" is starting its first loan cycle with the organization Pro Mujer. They are working with one of the organization's regional offices in Los Andes. The communal bank has six members and is led by a governing board where Santusa acts as secretary. 
The businesses of the group members are varied: food selling, coca selling, blanket weaving, glove weaving, clothes selling, and sewing.
The loan will benefit micro-entrepreneurs, one of whom is Santusa. She indicates that she is joining Pro Mujer for the first time, after being invited by a promoter for the institution who visited her at her home.
She currently has a business where she weaves gloves and sweaters. She started this business years ago, learning on her own initiative. She is now exporting to Europe.
The loan will be used to increase her stock (to purchase wool). She will acquire this stock at wholesale stores and, after manufacturing she will sell retail on demand. This way of work allows her to generate income to provide for her family. She lives with her partner and they have two children.
When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to purchase wool

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is 47 years old, married and a mother of four children. She sells cosmetics in Limuru and has been in this business for nine years now. She earns a monthly income of 80,000 shillings.

This will be Consolata's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire amount to pay for a business license and to buy more stock of cosmetics. 

In the future she would like to be a wholesaler and a supplier.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and pay for an annual business license

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single woman of thirty-six years. She has one child. Mary operates a general store on the outskirts of Limuru. She is also an M-pesa agent. She has been in this business for five years now, and she gets a monthly income of KES 50,000.

This will be Mary's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to stock maize flour, rice, cooking oil, etc., and also use part of the money to pay for the business license. 


In the future she wants to own the business premises and a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to stock cooking oil, maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully doing tailoring work from her home for many years while her husband works as a rickshaw driver and earns sufficient income to meet the needs of his family members. But at the moment his rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning well. For this reason, Shabana has applied for a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) for her husband, who wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. Shabana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Conny

texts.en:
Conny is married and has two children.  She works hard to support her family.  She has a restaurant business in Likoni and earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut. 

Conny is requesting a loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust for 15,000 KES, which she will use to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant.  In the past, Conny has sustained her business activities through loans from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo is 42 years old, married and blessed with four children. He has farmed cabbage and potatoes for the last 10 years, making a monthly income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

He has applied for his second loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD.,  which he plans to use to purchase planting seeds and fertilizers to use in his farm for better yields. 

The anticipated profits will expand the farm acreage. His future dream is business success.

loans.use: To purchase planting seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is 22 years old. He lives with his brother and parents in Batumi District, West Georgia. His brother is a sailor. Amiran requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is a small income earned by Amiran’s father, who is working as an auto repairer locally for 400 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Amiran requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Amiran will renovate four rooms on the second floor of their house. After the rooms are renovated, he plans to rent them out and earn money. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to renovate four rooms for renting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock like sheep and more goats to rear for trade.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is married and operates a soap and shampoo manufacturing business in Limuru, which she has been doing for two years.  She earns a monthly income of 60,000 KES.

Ann is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy chemicals for making soap and shampoo to sell.   In the future, she wants to own a car to help her cut her costs of business transport and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals in bulk for making soap.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny, de 26 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, esta casada con Richard quien es comerciante y padre de sus hijos de 04 y 02 años de edad. Juntos habitan su propia casa la cual es fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación.Jenny se dedica a la venta de bebidas tales como gaseosas y cervezas de distintas marcas  , estas ventas las realiza desde su hogar en donde a acondicionado un espacio para poder atender a sus clientes de manera amable y cordial, ganándose asi la preferencia de las personas de su zona. Tiene más de 01 año dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de otra persona que le ayuda a atender a sus clientes.Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos, además de contar con un oficio y sentirse una persona productiva. Como meta a largo plazo espera ampliar su negocio, e incursionar en otro negocio, como el alquiler de cuartos.Este será el préstamo número 03 con MFP y se siente agradecida por el apoyo finaciero que recibe .En esta oportunidad solicitara S/1000 soles para comprar bebidas tales como gaseosas y cervezas  de distintas marcas para su negocio .
texts.en:
Jenny, 26, is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is married to Richard, who is a salesman and the father of her children, who are four and two years old. They live together in their own house, which is the result of their hard work and dedication.

Jenny sells beverages, such as sodas and beers of different brands. She set up a space at home in order to give her customers a good service, which is something that local people will appreciate. Jenny has been doing this for over a year, and there is one more person that helps her to take care of the customers. She likes to have this business since it gives her an income and an activity that makes her feel productive. Her long-term goal is to expand her business and offer and additional service: renting rooms.

This is Jenny’s third loan with MFP and she appreciates the financial support she receives. This time, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles [PEN] to buy beverages, such as sodas and beers of different brands.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 33 years old. She is from Nakuru and is married to Moxley; they have three children aged between 8 and 12 years.

Jane has been in the charcoal business for the past eight years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loan successfully. She hopes to use the loan amount to buy stock of charcoal for sale.

She hopes to grow her business and to diversify into dairy farming in the near future.

loans.use: To buy stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza  is 46 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married  and has five children, with four of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Tereza has been working hard to manage her retail business, in which she sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Tereza has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal to sell, and will help Tereza to generate greater profits and improve the family's standard of living and also pay school fees for her children. Tereza hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Tereza  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Tereza who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to by more charcoal to sell and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sandra Maribel

texts.es: Doña Sandra vive con 6 familiares, que le ayudan en la crianza y engorde de cerdos (en la fotografia se logran visualizar los corrales o barracas, que es donde resguarda a los animales para que no se los roben. Adicionalmente, hornea quezadillas los dias domingos. Esta solicitando financiamiento para el engorde de sus cerdos, ya que los vende a mejor precio, si han ganado peso
texts.en:
Sandra lives with 6 relatives who help her to raise and fatten pigs. In the picture you can see the stalls where she keeps her animals so they won't be stolen. Additionally, she bakes sweet cheese pound-cakes on Sundays.
She is asking for financing to buy supplies to fatten her pigs, because she can get a better price for them if they have gained weight.

loans.use: to buy supplies to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Ms. Shahnaz is a 54-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue, so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: We Go Pay Group

texts.en: Tidankay is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in eastern Sierra Leone 36 years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has three children - one in primary school and two in secondary school. For three years now, Tidankay has been selling cooked food. This is the first loan that she and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Tidankay will use her share of the loan to buy large quantities of ingredients like palm oil (the country's most popular cooking oil), tomatoes, onions and fish in order to cook a large volume of "ebba" for sale.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like palm oil, tomatoes, onions and fish in large quantities to cook a large volume of "ebba" for sale

loans.name: Zaiba

texts.en: Ms. Zaiba is a vigorous, hardworking lady. She has been in business as a beauty parlor owner for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. By providing the best services, she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetic products for the parlor. But because she has little cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her 3rd loan. She needs a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy hair care products, skin products, and cream for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful that she will be able to cater to more customers time after time, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Janiffer

texts.en:
Janiffer is an entrepreneur with the vision to succeed. She is single and has one child, who is her reason for living.  She works as a cosmetologist in her own beauty salon. She has been in this profession for seven years, acquiring wide experience and a large number of customers too.

Janiffer is asking for a loan from Yehu Microfinance in order to equip her salon with all the necessary products such as professional shampoo, conditioners, hair dyes, and various beauty products and cosmetics.

Janiffer wants to increase her earnings and also improve her services in order to have a better life with her child.

loans.use: to buy hair products for her beauty salon such as shampoo, conditioners and hair dyes.

loans.name: Pastoritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PASTORITAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Modesta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: carpintería, venta de comida, ayudante de construcción, elaboración de alfombras de lana, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Modesta es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años, por el concejo de su hermana que vende este mismo producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne) que adquirirá de las vendedoras  mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializara en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones en crédito.
texts.en:
Pastoritas Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle withPro Mujer as part of Los Andes Regional Office.  It's made up of seven members governed by a board of directors of which Modesta is the president.  The various businesses of the communal bank members include carpentry, food sales, construction assistant, making wool rugs, neighborhood store, and vegetable sales.

Their loan will benefit small business entrepreneurs such as Modesta, a member.  She says she joined Pro Mujer six months ago on the invitation of a loan officer of the institution who visited her at her house.  Currently she has a business selling meat.  She says she started this business years ago on the advice of her sister, who sells the same product.

This loan will be to increase her capital buying meat that she'll get from wholesale vendors and later sell in her fixed sales stall.

This form of work allows her to generate income to support her household as much as possible, because she lives in a common-law relationship and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health field and the loan trainings.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a woman of twenty six years, married to James, who sells shoes in the Ndumberi division of Kiambi, Kenya. She has been in this business for two years now and she earns a monthly income of eighteen thousand shillings.

This will be Jackline's first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan to buy new shoes to sell. In future, she wants to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Jovanis

texts.en:
Jovanis is 52 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is widowed and has four children. For the past ten years, Jovanis has been working hard to manage her timber business, in which she trades in timber. 

To help expand her business, Jovanis has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber to sell and will help Jovanis to generate greater profits and invest money in the business. Jovanis hopes that, in the future, she will be able to put her children through school. 

Jovanis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Jovanis, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more timber to sell.

loans.name: Naomie

texts.en: Naomie is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon in Likoni, near Mombasa town. She is married and has 2 children. Naomie has been a hairdresser for 4 years. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children, and pay their school fees. She will use her loan to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the profits she generates to acquire equipment to make her work easier.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Bijabu

texts.en:
Bijabu works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food preparation and vending business in Likoni, Mombasa. Bijabu requested a 20,000 KES loan through Yehu Microfinance to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for five years.

Bijabu would like to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Las Magnificas De Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MAGNIFICAS DE FRANZ TAMAYO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ignacia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas de hilo, elaboración de colchones, tienda de barrio, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ignacia es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de jugos de quinua; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años, por el concejo de su prima que vende este mismo producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de quinua por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializara en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y el interés.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS MAGNIFICAS DE FRANZ TAMAYO" is starting its second loan cycle with the organization Pro Mujer. They are working with one of the organization's regional offices in Los Andes. The communal bank has nine members and is led by a governing board where Ignacia acts as president.
The businesses of the group members are varied: blanket weaving, mattress manufacturing, neighborhood grocery store, food selling.
The loan will benefit micro-entrepreneurs, one of whom is Ignacia. She indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for six months, after having been invited to join by a promoter for the institution who visited her at her home. She currently has a business selling quinoa juice. She started this business years ago, following the advice of a cousin who also sells this product.
