She will use this loan to increase her stock (purchase of quinoa wholesale) which she will buy in wholesale stores. After manufacturing, she will sell her products at her stall. This way of working allows her to generate resources to provide for her household because she is married and has three children.
When asked about what she likes from Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health care area and the loan rate.

loans.use: to purchase quinoa

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en: Ms. Haleema is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is Haleema’s husband. They have gained 25 years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing their stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts for years. They have two children and are motivated to provide them with good-quality food and clothing, and keep them healthy. Haleema wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is in her 3rd loan with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Zamu

texts.en:
Zamu is 39 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married  and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 10 years, Zamu has been working hard to manage her timber business which trades in timber. 

To help expand her business, Zamu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber, and will help Zamu to generate greater profits and expand the business. Zamu hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land. 

Zamu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Zamu, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more timber

loans.name: David

texts.en: David used his previous loan to purchase animal feeds and his monthly income has increased to 100,000 KES. He is borrowing a loan of 50,000 KES which he wants to use to pay for transport expenses for transporting milk to his customers. He will increase the stock of milk with the anticipated profit from the business. This is his fourth loan and he successfully paid his previous loan.

loans.use: to pay for transport expenses for his milk

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is now working in the ministry of education. She is caring for her three daughters and a son. As for her own business, she owns a number of sheep that she raises and takes care of to sell. She enhanced her business and started using its milk for making yogurt and cheese. Now she is applying for another loan to increase the number of sheep she has to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to buy more sheep.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: El Sr. Bernardo tiene 27 años, el se dedica a la confección de chamarras, el se dedica a esta actividad hace dos años, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la localidad de Cullucachi, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Bernardo utilizara este préstamo para compra de material de construcción para hacer terminar su taller,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, El Sr. Bernardo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas de vestir y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y confeccionar variedad de prendas de vestir El Sr. Bernardo se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Bernardo is twenty-seven years old and earns a living making jackets.  He has been in this business for two years, and his workshop is located in the small town of Cullucachi.  

This loan is his first sequence within the institution.  Bernardo will use this loan to buy construction material in order to finish his workshop.  His reason for requesting this loan is lack of working capital.

Bernardo faces challenges in his business, like continuing to improve the quality of sewing in his clothing items, and he is going to utilize profits to continue growing his working capital.  He wishes for his business to grow and to make a variety of clothing items.  

Bernardo feels happy and is thankful to the institution for the support offered to him.

loans.use: to finish construction on his workshop.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 67 years old and comes from Nakuru. He has four children of whom two are in school.

Joshua hasbeen in the tailoring business for the past twenty-eight years.He has applied for his second loan from  KADET LTD after repaying his previous loan successfully. 


He intends to use the loan amount to buy fabric and materials for making clothes. He hopes to buy a plot of land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy  fabric and materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima  region of Uganda. She is single  and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Eva has been working hard to manage her piggery; she sells pork. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to start poultry farming  and will help Eva to generate greater profits and look after the family. Eva hopes that in the future she will be able to start constructing rental houses. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eva who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to start poultry farming

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old single guy. He has two brothers and one sister. 

Despite his young age, Ahmad opened a medium-size food market, and he is still working on enhancing it by improving the types of goods he provides. 

Now Ahmad is applying for a youth loan to bring in more products other than food and have a variety in what he sells.

loans.use: to bring in more products other than food.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children, with 4 of them currently in school. For the past four years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his garments business, which sells children’s and ladies’ clothes. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and boost the business. 

Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to pay tuition for his children. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 29 years old, is married to Jecinta and the father of one child. He runs a butchery shop and also has a motorcycle transport business in Kiambu. James has been in the butchery business for two years now, and earns a monthly income of sixty thousand shillings.

This will be James' second loan from KADET LTD, with which he plans to buy pigs for slaughter so that he can sell the meat at his shop. In the future, he plans to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy pigs for slaughter.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is still selling charcoal in Mombasa, and she says that her business improved after the boost from the previous loan to add more stock. She informs us that her family is doing well and that she is happy with the ways things are.

She is currently requesting another loan to add more stock of 50 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase 50 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is a 40-year-old conservative woman; she asked her husband to take her place in the photo. They have three sons and a daughter. 

Raya’s husband has a fruit and vegetable sales business, although he does not have his own shop, people remember his usual spot and go to buy from him, knowing that every morning he goes to the main market to get fresh fruit and vegetables to sell in his area. Now Raya wants to help her husband, so she applied for this loan to increase the quantity of fruit and vegetables he can buy for resale and work on building a small tent for the business.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of fruit and vegetables he sells

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra, 57 years old and a widow, is a mother of three sons. With her smile, Zahra kept on supporting her sons and started selling blankets and clothes at home to be able to pay the household and family expenses. Now Zahra is applying for a loan to increase the quantity she has of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to increase the quantity she has of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a thirty-four-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For five years now he has been selling saucepans and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Insufficient supply from the factory affects his business growth while his dream is to diversify and trade in other products. Emmanuel intends to use the loan to buy saucepans to sell.

loans.use: to buy  saucepans to sell.

loans.name: Nishane

texts.en:
Nishane is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli town. Now she lives in the Fuzuli region with her family. Nishana is married and has two children. She is 47 years old. 

Nishane has been in the food products sales business for a year. She wants to improve her new business. 

Now she needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy new products for her shop.

loans.use: to buy products for her shop.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a business-lady with two children. She has been in business for one year and works very hard in order to support her children on her own. 

Kwekwe was previously involved in a farming business, and Yehu Microfinance has helped her to develop a saving ethic. She hopes to have a large grocery store someday and to increase her profits. 

Kwekwe needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy avocados, oranges, mangoes, pawpaws, passion fruits, and spinach.

loans.use: to buy avocados, oranges, mangoes, pawpaws, passion fruits, and spinach.

loans.name: Athman

texts.en:
This marks Athman's second loan from KADET LTD. He has been able to expand his flock, thus having a need to expand the poultry house with this second loan. 

He hopes to rear broilers and be able to supply the entire county.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and expand the poultry house.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia is a single mother   of two children and both her children go to school. She has a beauty salon .She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 700,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of hair weaves, braids, cream relaxers and other cosmetics.  She has been in this business for four years and sells to all   categories of people but on  a retail basis seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves   and seasonality.  She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of hair weaves, cream relaxers, braids and cosmetic items.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a man of forty-nine yeard. Married to Jane and a father of four children, he operates a food stall in Kiambu, and he has been in this business for two years now. Samuel gets a monthly income of sixty thousand shillings.

This will be Samuel's third loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to add goods to his food shop, buying cooking oil, maize flour and sugar, etc., for sale. 


In future he wants to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy stock of consumables wholesale like cooking oil, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a 47-year-old housewife, and she still has one single son living with her. Her husband works outside the country and transfers money on a monthly basis. Huda on the other hand wanted to make a good use of her free time, so she started a small business at home that can cover some of the emergency cases during the months, if there are any.  Huda is selling make-up products, clothing items and sometimes detergents. Now she is applying for a loan to get a new spring collection of clothes to sell to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to get a new spring collection of clothes for resale

loans.name: Ebtihaj

texts.en:
Ebtihaj, 27 years old and a single lady, lives with her mother and sister after their father passed away. Her only brother is married and helps in supporting the family as much as he can. 

Ebtihaj feels that getting support from her brother is a lot to ask of him as he has his own family to look after, so she has recently started a small business at home selling clothes and blankets. Now Ebtihaj is applying for a youth loan to bring in more clothing items to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to bring in more clothing items

loans.name: Nahid

texts.en:
Nahid is 29 years old. He is married and has a child. 

Nahid has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from occupied territories (Fizuli city). But now he lives in Fuzuli region with his family. 

Nahid needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy calves. 

Nahid has been in this agriculture business for three years. He increases his cattle. His father taught him this business.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a married woman with five children. She sells greens and a variety of vegetables from a small stall in the central market in Tiribe. She has a variety of customers, and her work day starts at 5:30 AM. She finishes work at 8:30 PM. She works hard every day so that she can have a better future. Margret wants to have more customers from Mombasa, but she needs a little money to buy vegetables and grocery items so she can sell them from her small stall so that she can have better earnings. This is what she most needs in order to improve the living conditions for her and her children.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to diversify her selection

loans.name: Mayra Nocolasa

texts.es: Doña Mayra, es soltera con mucho trabajo y dedicación ha logrado que sus hijos hoy en día sean independientes y de buenas costumbres, en años atrás tenía el negocio de pulpería pero no le era rentable, ahora  tiene la venta de pan desde hace muchos años, en la actualidad está optando a su cuarto crédito para infraestructura para mejorar la pared interna de la casa, ya que una parte es de plywood y necesita hacerla toda de concreto para lograr mayor solidez en las paredes, necesitara comprar cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, piedrines y empezar la obra.
texts.en:
Mayra is single and with much work and dedication, she has achieved her children's independence and good habits. She used to have a general store but it proved to be unprofitable. Now, for many years she has sold bread. 

Mayra is requesting her 4th infrastructure loan, this time to strengthen the internal walls of her house. At present, they are partly plywood and all need to be concrete in order to achieve more solidity. To do this, Mayra needs to purchase cement, sand, construction iron, concrete blocks, roof supports, and to pay laborers to begin the work.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, construction iron, concrete blocks, roof supports, and to begin the work.

loans.name: William's Group

texts.en:
William is a fifty-nine-year-old farmer and a father of six children. He and his wife keep animals and grow food crops such as maize, cowpeas, and cassava. His farming business is affected by drought, and he lacks the funds he needs to buy pesticides to protect his crops.

William decided to become a KOMAZA tree farmer because he believes the trees will restore the environment and bring more rainfall to his area. He is looking forward to receiving the inputs and technical training from KOMAZA. He hopes to use the money he makes from his harvest to provide high quality education to his children and build a better house.

loans.use: To pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis  is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kijura  in the Hoima  region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Francis  has been working hard to manage his farming business; he sells milk and rears cows. 

To help expand his business, Francis  has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cows to milk and will help Francis  to generate greater profits and boost his business. Francis  hopes that in the future he will be able to meet family needs. 

Francis  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.




"

loans.use: to buy more cows to milk

loans.name: Eresi

texts.en: Eresi used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children.She is a thirty-six-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been teaching for twelve years and she is passionate about her job since it helps her to reach out to communities as has always been her dream. Her personal goal is educating children and setting up other income-generating activities to supplement her salary. Eresi intends to use the money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo belongs to Yehu Microfinance Trust located in Mombasa, Kenya. She has seven children and is married. She alternates her daily activities with her petrol-selling business which she has had for a number of years. It is going well for her, thanks to the daily effort she puts into her work. She works selling petrol to motorcycle operators and paraffin for use in lighting lamps, and works from Monday to Saturday from approximately 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. The member is a responsible person and so she gets her family ahead.

Mwanakombo is grateful for the loan she has been given and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase petrol for resale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 54 años, tiene 4 hijos y está casada con Pablo con quien vive en su casa propia .Carmen durante su trabajo, realiza muchas actividades, pero la principal es la venta de abarrotes, tiene un pequeña bodega acondicionada en su hogar, en donde espera a sus clientes que van en busca de cualquier tipo de producto que están seguros de encontrar ahí. Lleva haciendo éste trabajo más de 9  años, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo.Le gusta su trabajo pues  es independiente, tiene tiempo disponible para realizar otras actividades, además de poder asistir de manera puntual y tranquila a su empleo como docente en una institución educativa de la ciudad. En su negocio siempre tiene clientes, además como mantuvo un buen record de compras de una distribuidora de gaseosas, le pusieron una exhibidoras para sus productos, tiene grandes planes con su negocio, como hacerlo crecer, cree que más adelante podrá ampliar ya que uno de sus proyectos primordiales es el de agrandar su tienda de abarrotes.Este es el crédito número 05 con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, por su parte se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1800 soles, comprará más productos para ofrecer ya que los abarrotes  como arroz azúcar, harina, huevos entre otros, están experimentando un cambio de precio y los puede ofrecer a un mejor precio y seguir teniendo a sus clientes contentos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 54, has four children and is married to Paul.  She lives in her own house.  Carmen generates income through a number of activities, but the main one is selling groceries. She has a small store that is set up in her house where she awaits her customers.  Her customers are sure to find all of the varied types of products they are looking for in her store.  

Carmen has had this business for more than 9 years, and her husband helps her with the business.  She enjoys her work, because as she works independently, she has the time available to carry out other activities.  With this business, she is also able to work in a punctual and tranquil manner as a teacher in an educational institution in the city.  

Carmen always has customers in her business, and she's maintained a good record of purchases from a soft drink distributor who has put promotional product displays in her business.  She has big plans for the business on how she will make it grow.  She believes that in the future she will expand it, because one of her main plans is to enlarge her grocery store.  

This is Carmen's 5th loan with Kiva.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support, because this way she feels secure in moving forward with the business.  In turn, she promises to make her payments on time.

With the sum of 1,800 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy more products to offer, including products like rice, sugar, flour, eggs, and other items.  The prices of these items are changing, so she can offer them at a better price and thus continue to have satisfied customers.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, and other groceries

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: don marcial vive con su esposa y una hija, el es un hombre muy responsable quien siempre está en miras de mejorar su estabilidad económica. El solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para contar con la ayuda necesaria para invertir en la compra de leña.Esto es importante porque así mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y la de el.
texts.en:
Marcial lives with his wife and daughter. He is a very responsible man who is always looking to improve his economic stability. 

He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL for the help necessary to invest in the purchase of firewood. This is important because this is how he will improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for his shop.

loans.name: Yazgul

texts.en:
Yazgul is not married for now. Her husband left her and their two children. And he did not help them. 

Yazgul is a hardworking person. She wants to make her children happy. Now she needs a loan of 2300 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy new cookware and a new stove. Yazgul does cooking at her home and sells cooked dishes. Sometimes she goes to the other person's home to cook  them food (on birthdays or other special days, etc.) 

Yazgul has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) person from Fizuli city. Now she lives in Fuzuli region with her beautiful children.

loans.use: to buy new cookware and a new stove

loans.name: Mushvig

texts.en: Mushvig is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) who once lived in his nation's occupied territories. He moved from Fizuli city to the Fuzuli region. He is 24 years old, single and has been in his current line of work for two years. He works to help his mother, and is requesting a loan for AZN 2,300 to improve his business by buying vegetables to resell.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina con continua  con su actividad económica principal que es la elaboración y venta de panes “Chuta”, ella sigue teniendo su propio horno donde prepara panes “Chutas”. (El pan CHUTA es un típico pan de la ciudad del cusco, caracterizado por ser un pan gigante que mide aproximadamente unos 30 x30 cm y 4 a 4 cm de grueso y por ser un pan muy delicioso, tanto así que muchos turistas gustan llevar una muestra a sus familiares como obsequio, a fin de que puedan estos saborear un poquito de la magia que envuelve a la ciudad imperial del cusco.)

En esta oportunidad Alejandrina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo manteca,  sacos de harina, levadura, sacos de azúcar y muchas cosas más.  

Alejandrina sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina continues with her main economic activity which is baking and selling "Chuta" bread. 

She still has her own oven where she bakes "chuta". "Chuta" is a typical bread from the city of Cusco characterized for being a very big. It measures approximately 30x30cm and 4x4cm in thickness. It is a delicious bread so much so that many tourists like to bring a sample to their families as a souvenir. This way they can taste a bit of the magic from the imperial city of Cusco.

Alejandrina is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as butter, sacks of flour, yeast, bags of sugar and many other things. 

Alejandrina still belongs to the communal bank “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” of the Arariwa Association. She is thankful to the opportunity given and she is committed to repaying her loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as butter, sacks of flour, yeast, bags of sugar and many other things.

loans.name: Maria Fatima

texts.es: maria de 27 años vive con su hijo es madre soltera, se dedica a la agricultura siembra los principales granos básicos como son: maíz y frijol, solicita un prestamo el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios.
texts.en: María, 27, lives with her son; she’s a single mother who works in agriculture growing crops of basic grains like corn and beans.  She’s requesting a loan to be able to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, etc.  She’d like to have this support because she has no other source of income.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en: Zaina is married and the mother of one child who attends school. For the last four years, she has earned a living by providing tailoring services. She is requesting a loan for KES. 30,000 from Yehu Microfinance to buy more fabric for dressmaking, and will use her profits to expand her business. Her future dream is to have a successful life.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Orsi Benjamín

texts.es:
Orsi tiene 30 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Él aprendió a cuidar ganado y a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad. Aprendió el trabajo con un tío. A Orsi no se le presento la oportunidad de estudiar, debido a eso se dedico al cuido de animales y a sembrar yuca para obtener ingresos que le permitan subsistir.  Para ir a comprar los insumos que necesita, debe viajar en un pick up durante treinta minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres novillos de repasto y para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de yuca. Con la compra de los novillos, él obtendrá ingresos adicionales de los que le genera los trabajos agrícolas y que su familia no le falte lo necesario para vivir. Su sueño, es construir su propia casa; ya que actualmente vive en casa de otra persona.
texts.en:
Orsi, 30, has a spouse and a son.  He learned to raise cattle and to work in agriculture since he was 12 years old.  He learned how to work from an uncle.  Orsi never had the opportunity to go to school which is why he went into caring for animals and growing manioc in order to earn income to support himself.  To buy the supplies he needs he must make a thirty-minute trip by pick-up truck to the city.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy three grazing calves and to plant 7,000 square meters of manioc.  With the purchase of the calves he’ll earn extra income from what he earns from agriculture so his family will not lack what’s needed to live on.  His dream is to build his own house because the one he currently lives in belongs to someone else.

loans.use: to buy three grazing calves and to plant 7,000 square meters of manioc.

loans.name: 22-Virgen De Urkupina Group

texts.es: La Sra. Roció sigue con la misma actividad de la venta  de prendas militares de vestir,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa militar por mayor,  cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que surtió su tienda y tiene mucha clientela y tiene pedidos que entregar.
texts.en:
Roció continues her work of selling military clothing. 

She is asking for a loan so she can buy military clothes at whole sale. 

Her last loan went very well as she was able to fill her shop. She has a large clientele and orders to fill.

loans.use: to buy military clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Jessenia Lisbet

texts.es:
Jessenia es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Jessenia pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las acogedoras calles de su ciudad.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jessenia trabaja como asistente en una empresa agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jessenia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos para la tramitación de sus certificados de estudios de su carrera técnica, de esta manera ella podrá contar con los documentos necesarios para poder iniciar el trámite que corresponda para la entrega de su título profesional, así pues Jessenia seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jessenia, 21, lives in the city of Chiclayo in Guadalupe District with her parents and siblings.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Thanks to her efforts and to her parents’ support, Jessenia was able to study business administration.  She enjoys going for walks along her city’s welcoming streets in her free time.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Jessenia works as an assistant in one of the city’s agricultural firms.  She works every day for about 8 hours daily and thinks she does well because of the good way she does her job and the kind way she treats others.

Jessenia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to pay the expenses associated with her technical career’s certificates so she will have the necessary documentation on hand she needs to get her professional title.  In this way, Jessenia will be able to continue working and striving towards her great dream of owning a house.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Maria Andrea es casada, tiene 42 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos que estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la artesania, especificamente a la elaboracion de bordados de blusas, inicio este negocio con sus hermanas y hasta la fecha lleva 8 años de experiencia.

Solicita un credito que lo utilizara para comprar tela y lustrina para poder realizar su trabajo. en el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y quiere tener trabajadores.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Andrea is married and is 42 years old. She never had the chance to study, and has two children who are studying. She works making handicrafts, more specifically embroidering blouses. She began this business with her sisters and today, she has eight years of experience.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric and silk cloth for her work. In the future, she wants her to grow her business and employ others.

loans.use: to buy fabric and silk cloth.

loans.name: Bihanifa

texts.ru: Биханифа четвертый раз кредитуется в ИМОН. Все раннее займы она погасила. Биханифа добросовестная, целеустремленная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в сельской местности, который имеет хорошие условия для животноводства и выращивание сельхоз культур. Уже несколько лет она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Ее муж Одилчон, помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. В основном они выращивают ячмень. Однако в прошлом сезоне они не получили хороший урожай. Этой зимой им было тяжело справляться с расходами семьи, так как у них есть 3 несовершеннолетних детей. Биханифа решила организовать новый бизнес животноводством. С такой целью она обратилась в ИМОН, чтобы получить займ, и начать свой новый бизнес. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она нуждается и ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ей улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en:
Bihanifa is taking her fourth loan from IMON. She paid all her previous loans back early. Bihanifa is a conscientious, focused, and hardworking woman. She was born in a rural area which has good conditions for livestock and agriculture. 

For several years, she has been engaged in raising crops. Her husband Odiljon helps her to run the business. Mainly, they grow barley. Last season, however, they did not get a good harvest. This winter has been quite hard for them to cope with the family's expenses because they have three small children. 

Bihanifa decided to establish a new business raising livestock. To that end, she approached IMON in order to get a loan and to begin a new business. She took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. This loan will help her to improve living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Fiorella Antonia

texts.es:
Fiorella es una mujer de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es madre y padre para sus pequeños; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Fiorella no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agricultura , pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su abuelo, Fiorella trabaja en su pequeña parcela, donde tiene diversos cultivos, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y esfuerzo.
Fiorella se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de riego y abono de su cultivo, de esta manera Fiorella podrá obtener una buena cosecha, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para logar su gran sueño de sacar adelante la chacra que sus abuelos le heredaron.
texts.en:
Fiorella is 27 years old, and lives in the city of Nazca with her two children, who she loves and are her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person. She gives her all to providing for her family, as she is both the mother and father to her little ones. Unfortunately, due to a lack of money and the need to work from a young age, Fiorella was unable to study professional Agriculture,  but she would have really liked to. In her free time, she enjoys listening to music and sometimes, she cooks delicious pasta with tomato sauce to share with her family.

With huge amounts of effort and dedication, and thanks to the support of her grandfather, Fiorella farms her small plot, where she grows various crops. She works approximately eight hours every day, and thinks that she is doing well thanks to her experience and efforts.

Fiorella is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she can cover the costs of watering and fertilizing her crop. In this way, Fiorella will be able to get a good harvest, and continue to work to achieve her big dream of succeeding with the plot of land she inherited from her grandparents.

loans.use: to cover the costs of watering and fertilizing her crop.

loans.name: Munkhbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhbayar, 31 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The couple resides in their own house on a plot of land. His wife studies at the university and will be graduating this year. He himself has been rendering taxi service to local people for two years. Besides taxi service, he also does building decoration work. 

Munkhbayar finished building his house on his land in 2007 and since that time the house has been deteriorating over the years and needs some renovation. So he is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement, planks and a hardwood floor. As a result, the couple will be able to live in a more comfortable and warmer place in the cold period, especially in winter. The renovated house will also enable the family to burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement and planks

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en: Mr. Batjargal, 35 years old, lives with his mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His mother has retired from work and gets a pension from the state. For almost two years, he has been working at a factory where vacuum-insulated windows are manufactured. Also he rents an automobile to local people who provide taxi services with it. He is requesting a loan of 6,500,000 MNT to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas. A main advantage of a natural gas vehicle is that its emissions are cleaner: there are lower emissions of carbon and lower particulate emissions per equivalent distance traveled. Also it wastes less fuel. So purchasing this automobile is both beneficial to him and to the environment. Mr. Batjargal is a very hardworking individual who wants to improve his family's standard of living for his mother. His mother’s only wish is to see her son living happily.

loans.use: to purchase a low-emissions natural gas vehicle

loans.name: Unurbat

texts.en:
Mr. Unurbat, 31 years old, lives with his son and wife in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His wife has a position in logistics monitoring professionals in the air traffic industry. His son goes to kindergarten. He himself has been working as a senior professional at the department of information and advertisement in the free trade zone. The apartment the family live in has been flooded with rain numerous times due to its weak ceiling. Also because of vulnerable windows and walls, the family is chilled to their core in winter time. 

For these reasons, Mr. Unurbat is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as wallpaper, vacuum insulated windows, ceilings and fiber glass for insulation and repair of the house. As a result, the family will be able to live in a warm and comfortable place in winter. The renovated house will have the benefit of not losing its heat and thus preserving energy. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase wallpaper, vacuum insulated windows, ceilings and fiberglass

loans.name: Shohista

texts.ru: Шохиста добрая и мотивированная женщина. Ей 25 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она родилась в сельской местности, и имеет достаточный опыт по скотоводству и земледелием. Она заключила договор с дехканским хозяйством об аренде  земли, где она будет выращивать хлопок. Хлопок в Таджикистане является развитым сектором сельхоз деятельности и имеет большой спрос в мировом рынке. Это энергичная и молодая женщина решила организовать свой бизнес выращиванием хлопка. Ее родители будут помогать ей в ведении бизнеса. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ в сумме 2000 Сомони для оплаты аренды земли. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shohista is a kind and motivated woman. She is 25 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She was born in a rural area and has sufficient experience with raising livestock and crops. 

She signed a contract with a dekhan farm land lease, where she will grow cotton. (In Tajikistan, "dehkan farms" are midsized peasant farms that are legally and physically distinct from household plots.) Cotton in Tajikistan is a developed agricultural sector and has great demand in the world market. 

This energetic and young woman decided to establish her own business growing cotton. Her parents will help her in the business. She took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. 

She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to pay the rent for the land.

loans.use: to pay rent for land to organize a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 16 femmes existe depuis le 15/12/2008, date de création du Banc Villageois .

Coumba responsable du groupe est une veuve avec 5 enfants à sa charge.Elle s'active dans le petit commerce de chaussures ,de tissus et de pochettes.Elle s’approvisionne à la capitale pour les revendre ensuite dans son village. 
Elle a commencé son activité avec la venue de CAURIE dans son village fin 2008.

Avec les bénéfices obtenus elle veut développer son épargne et prendre en charge les dépenses familiales.
texts.en: This group of 16 women has been together since December 15, 2008, the date when their Banc Villageois was founded. The leader of the group is a widow named Coumba who has five children in her care. She runs a small business selling shoes, fabric and small pouches. She purchases her supplies in the capital and then resells them in her village. Coumba started her business with the help of CAURIE Microfinance, who came to her village in late 2008. With the income she earns, Coumba wants to increase her savings and pay for her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and shoes to resell in her village.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy es un hombre de 38 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 5 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Percy no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear con su familia por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de su ciudad.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Percy trabaja como asistente de compras en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, adicionalmente también vende madera , él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Percy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de un pequeño baño en su vivienda, él cual tendrá los servicios higiénicos necesarios para poder brindar mayor higiene, seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues Percy seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio negocio de venta de repuestos para autos.
texts.en:
Percy, 38, lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and little five-year-old son who he loves and is his reason for living.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic man who along with his wife focuses all his efforts into moving his family forward.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to start working very young, Percy was unable to study auto mechanics.  In his free time, he enjoys going on family outings along the warm, welcoming streets of his city.

On his own initiative and with munch effort and dedication, Percy works as a sales assistant for a commercial firm in his city and he also sells lumber.  He works every day for about 10 hours daily and believes he does well because of the good way he does his work and the kind customer service he provides.

Percy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to build a small bathroom at home in order to have all the necessary hygienic services to provide better hygiene and well-being for his family.  In this way, Percy will continue striving and working towards his great dream of having his own auto spare parts business.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemi de 68 años de edad,vive en casa propia y ahi es donde tiene su negocio de tortillas y pupusas, es una persona muy responsable,con capacidad de pago, el prestamo que solicita lo utilizara para la compra de materiales que utilizara en su negocio y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Noemi is 68 years old, and lives in her own home, which is where she has her business selling tortillas and pupusas- stuffed corn tortillas. She is a very responsible person, who is able to repay her loan. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy materials for her business, and in this way achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business (tortillas and stuffed tortillas called pupusas)

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назира благодарит всех инвесторов фонда КИВА за поддержку. Доходы увеличились и составляют в среднем 15,000 kGS.
На этот раз Назира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка для перепродажи. Доходы позволят улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Nazira thanks all Kiva lenders for their support. Her revenues have increased and average about 15,000 KGS.

This time, Nazira approached Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy bulls for resale. The income will improve the family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Kaiyrzat

texts.ru:
Кайырзат со своей семьей живет в одном из высокогорных сел Кыргызстана,что что на севере страны. Она от всей души благодарна за поддержку фонду КИВА. Она смогла увеличить свои доходы и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
 В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кайырзат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец на откорм и перепродажу. Кайырзат собирается открыть магазин возле дома.
texts.en:
Kaiyrzat and her family live in one of the mountain villages of Kyrgyzstan which is in the north of the country. She is sincerely grateful for Kiva's support. She was able to increase her income and improve the welfare of the family. 

In order to further develop her business, Kaiyrzat approached Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening and resale. Kaiyrzat is going to open a store near her home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Altynai

texts.ru: Алтынай 33 год, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей.  Старшая дочка учится в 4 классе. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Алтынай начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алтынай обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов овец. Доходы Алтынай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Altynai is 33 years old, married and is raising 3 children.  Her oldest daughter is in 4th grade.  In order to provide a source of income for her family, she began working with livestock.  She started this business with 10,000 KGS and it now brings in around 5,000 KGS a month from the sale of cattle.  With the goal of further growing her business, Altynai has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy additional sheep.  She plans to use the income from the loan to further improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Suma Khamaña Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA KHAMAÑA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de camélidos, producción de papa, venta de api, tienda de barrio, venta de refrescos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento al ver la necesidad de las personas de la comunidad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceites y fideos) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su propio domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
Suma Khamaña Communal Bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya regional office.  It's made up of nine members and governed by a board of directors of which Susana is the president.  The various businesses of the communal bank members include camelid sales, potato production, "apí" sales [non-alcoholic corn beverage], neighborhood store, and soft drink sales.

Their loan will benefit small business entrepreneurs such as Susana.  She says it's the first time she has belonged to Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a loan officer from the institution who visited her at her house.  Currently she has a neighborhood store business, which she says she started when she saw the need of people in her community.

This loan is to increase her capital by buying rice, oil, and noodles, which she'll get from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and later sell in her own house.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her household as much as possible, because she lives in a common-law relationship and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and noodles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Kadyira

texts.ru: Кадыйра 47 лет, замужем, воспитала 2 детей. Старший сын учится в университете, дочка ходит в школу. Кадыйра в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, 1995 года начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес с трех нетелей на сумму 9,000 KGS , благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Кадыйра имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы, 1 теленка, и 1 лошадь, что приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 12,000 сом. Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Кадыйра обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец с целью откорма и перепродажи, 1 корову для увеличения доходов от продажи молока. Доходы от кредита Кадыйра планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Kadyira is 47 years old, married, and raising two children. Her older son is studying at university, and her daughter goes to school. 

As a main source of income for her family, Kadyira began in 1995 to engage in raising livestock and growing crops. Having started this business with three heifers for 9,000 KGS, through hard work Kadyira today has on her farm two cows, one calf, and a horse, which bring in a monthly profit of 12,000 som. Concluding that this business is profitable, Kadyira approached Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening and resale, and a cow to increase revenues through selling milk. 

Kadyira plans to invest income from the loan to further expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and sheep

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es: Cordiales saludos. Este es el grupo “Sembrando Esperanza” la cual está conformada por 7 socios,  y llevan trabajando más de un año,  en el trascurso del tiempo dicho grupo han demostrado responsabilidad y solidaridad entre sus compañeros. Este es el caso de Ynes de 40 años de edad separada con 2 hijos en etapa escolar. Ynes se dedica a la venta de frutas, la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente, lleva trabajando de esta manera desde  hace muchos años. Fruto de su esfuerzo, es que ha podido cumplir algunos de sus sueños como mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos en su educación. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de frutas. Su mayor deseo es de conseguir un puesto en el mercado donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. El grupo “Sembrando Esperanza”  agradece a los que hicieron posible este crédito. Ynes es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca color azul.
texts.en:
Greetings from the Sembrando Esperanza group, which is made up of seven members who have been working for more than a year.  During this time the companions have shown responsibility and solidarity among themselves.

This is the case of Ynés, 40, who is separated and has two school-age children.  Ynés works selling fruit as a street vendor.  She has worked this way for many years.  As the fruit of her labor she has managed to achieve some of her dreams, such as improving her house and supporting her children in their education.

She requested the loan to buy fruit.  Her biggest desire is to get a stall in the market where she can sell her products.

The Sembrando Esperanza group is grateful to those who made this loan possible.

Ynés is the third person from the left and is wearing a blue coat.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Bitwahia

texts.en:
Bitwahia sells bicycles and their parts in a retail outlet that is very advantageously located. Her husband helps her with her business. Bitwahia offers a huge selection of products that are in constant demand from the local populace. 

Presently, she needs additional funds from Kiva in order to buy motorcycle spare parts. She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 of her own and needs this Kiva loan to make up the full cost of the purchase. Bitwahia can be characterized as a respectable, steady, and problem-free businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Angela's Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Angelar from Masvingo. She is married with eight children, six of whom are attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Angelar runs a retail business selling chickens, which has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge she faces is high competition in the market. 

Angelar has requested a loan of 200 USD to buy feed and chicks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her income and improve her family's welfare. In the future, Angelar plans to buy cows for dairy.

loans.use: to buy feed and chicks.

loans.name: Mwahamvi

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mwahamvi works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in Tiribe, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Mwahamvi is borrowing 20,000 KES through Yehu Microfinance to purchase additional supplies for her tailoring business, such as linens, pins, and tailoring chalk.

Mwahamvi has sustained her business activities through support from her husband.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Chiessa

texts.en:
Chiessa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fermented shrimp business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fermented shrimp to sell.

Chiessa has been in this business for nine years. Chiessa  earns more income from buying and selling livestock.

Chiessa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fermented shrimp to sell

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Felisa works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from running a general store. Felisa is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like needles, thread and garments for her tailoring business.

Felisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like needles, thread and garments for her business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Lilia is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her ready to wear business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her clothing business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 60 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Lilia is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Lilia has been farming sugarcane for 11 years and earns additional income from buying and selling livestock and from motorcycle transport.

Lilia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her farming sugarcane, livestock and motorcycle transport businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maty's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été fondé depuis le premier cycle  du banc villageois et il est composé de 5 femmes issues du même village et unies par de bonnes relations sociales.
Madame Élisabeth est la responsable, elle est mariée, âgée de 45 ans et mère de 8 enfants dont 5 scolarisés.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de produits divers depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Elle est debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo la main levée et habillée en boubou rouge bordeaux.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 245,000 francs cfa elle va acheter des sacs de riz et de mil, des cartons de sucre et de bonbons et des bidons d'huile e qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de sa boutique située à l'entrée du village.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires, scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants et renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group has been together since their first loan cycle as a Banc Villageois. It is made up of five women who live in the same village and who are united by good social relations. The leader of the group and is Élisabeth. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, with five attending school.

Élisabeth has been a merchant for quite some time, and has a good experience in her field. She is shown standing on the far left in the photo, with her hand raised and dressed in burgundy. With her new loan of 245,000 XOF, Élisabeth plans to buy bags of rice and millet, cartons of sugar and candy, and cans of oil, which she will retail at her shop situated at the entrance of her village. The income she earns will allow Élisabeth to support her children and pay for their food, education, and health needs. She will also be able to increase her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of grain and cans of oil to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Petr

texts.ru:
Петр - фермер. С 2010 года занимается выращиванием арбуза и дыни.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания дыни в открытом грунте.
Петр с супругой решили приобрести семена арбуза и дыни для расширения посевной площади.
В планах на будущее:  приобрести навесное оборудование, для вспашки своего земельного участка.
В личных планах: Достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования семян арбуза и дыни.
texts.en: Petr is a farmer and has grown cantaloupe and watermelons since 2010.  His spouse helps him with his work.  The growth of their business began by growing cantaloupe in an open field.  They have decided to purchase seeds to expand the area of land they farm.  In the future, they plan to purchase a tilling attachment for their tractor.  Personally, they plan to finishing building their house.  They need your financial support to buy watermelon and cantaloupe seeds.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Kim

texts.ru:
Ким  - фермер. С 1993 года занимается выращиванием арбуза и дыни.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга и двое детей 29-ти и 26-ти лет, младший сын работает поваром в ресторане.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания молодого лука в открытом грунте.
Ким с супругой решили приобрести капельную ленту и пленку для полива и защиты от холода и ветра арбуза и дыни .
В планах на будущее:  приобрести навесное оборудование к трактору для вспашки своего земельного участка, а также холодильное оборудование для хранения и охлаждения готовой продукции.
В личных планах: Обустройство жилого дома.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования капельной ленты и пленки.
texts.en: Kim is a farmer.  Since 1993, he has grown watermelon and cantaloupe.  His wife and his of his children (aged 29 and 26) help him with is work.  His youngest son works as a cook in a restaurant.  The growth of Kim's business began with planting onions in an open field.  He and his wife have decided to buy drip hosing and plastic to protect the crops from cold and wind.  In the future, they plan on buying a tilling attachment for their tractor and also refrigeration equipment for cooling and storing their harvests.  Their personal plans include building their own home.  They need your help financing the purchase of drip hosing and plastic.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved African masks and sculptures. He would like to buy raw materials like wood, polish, sandpaper, and wood stain for his craft business.

Gordon has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I was unable to finish secondary school because of economic limitations. After being taught how to carve by my brother, I moved to the city to seek new opportunities. After a while, I returned to my home city and established my workshop there, receiving indispensable moral support from my brother.

I am very grateful for your support through this microcredit loan. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Gordon's hand-carved wood art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2505

loans.use: to buy supplies for his craft business.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in hand-tooled leather furniture. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including leather and wood, in order to build up his stock of finished products.

Wilfredo has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story:

"When I was 13, in 1936, I went to work for a neighbor who crafted saddles. In 1954, I went to Lima in search of a better life. I saw a newspaper ad for a specialist to sew hemp by hand and was hired. The workshop crafted leather furniture, and, after a month, I took the place of the master craftsman when he retired. Today, my sons work with me. However, I've gone back to the traditional handmade techniques I learned at the beginning. I create the designs that once took us out of extreme poverty and opened a new path for us in this world.

Please receive a hug from across the miles as my way of thanking you for your selfless contribution to this microcredit loan. It will help me make more furniture, which in turn should help my sales."

Use the link below to view Wilfredo's wood and tooled leather furniture on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7202

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials for his crafts business.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is 37 years old and married with four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana production business in the local community. She has been in business for over five years and earns 3,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She hopes and dreams to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Milagros pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Marisco para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Milagros trabaja como asistente comercial en una empresa de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Milagros se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como cemento, arena, pintura y otros, de esta manera podrá tarrajear y pintar la casa de sus padres donde vive y contarán con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Milagros seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un negocio de venta de muebles.
texts.en:
Milagros is 20 years old, single, and lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and siblings.  She is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed.  Thanks to her effort and the support of her parents, Milagros was able to study Business Administration.  In her free time, she likes to play sports and sometimes cook rice and seafood to share with her family.

By her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Milagros works as a sales assistant at a business in her city.  She works every day for about eight hours and believes that is going well thanks to her good performance and kind treatment of her customers.

Milagros is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their support she will be able to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, paint, and other items in order to plaster and paint her parent's house where she lives.  This will provide them with more security and well-being so that Milagros can continue working and making an effort towards her dream of owning a furniture store.

loans.use: to purchase materials to plaster and paint her house.

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
Юрий  - фермер. С 2003 года занимается выращиванием арбуза и дыни.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания бахчевых культур и молодых помидор.
Юрий решил приобрести семена арбуза и дыни, капельную ленту и пленку для полива и защиты от холода и ветра арбуза и дыни.
В планах на будущее:  расширять свои посевные площади
В личных планах: Обустройство жилого дома.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования семян арбуза и дыни, капельной ленты и пленки.
texts.en: Yuriy is a farmer and has grown watermelons and cantaloupe since 2003.  The growth of his business started with growing melons and tomatoes.  Yuriy has decide to purchase seeds, drip hosing, and plastic to protect his crops from the cold and wind.  In the future, he plans to expand the area of land he farms.  His personal plans include building a home.  He needs your help to finance the purchase of watermelon and cantaloupe seeds, drip hosing, and plastic.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment and seeds

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in hand-carved marble chess sets and sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of materials such as marble and glue, as well as tools like a diamond saw, sand paper, and brushes.

Hector has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"When I was 14, I met a person who worked sculpting marble. I started to work with him, and I liked it. When I was 16, I started working on my own. The first pieces I sculpted were from the Maya culture. I'm passionate about my work. I knew that it was mine from the very first time I saw the uncut stones. I'm sure that this is the gift God gave me: the ability to imagine, design, and carve marble sculptures.

With this microcredit loan, I'll be able to continue working on new products. Without it, I wouldn't be able to build up stock, so thank you very much."

Use the link below to view Hector's hand-carved marble chess sets on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8000

loans.use: to purchase materials for his crafts business.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 36-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and six children in Al-Dawha near Bethlehem. He is employed in a construction supplies store. To improve the family income, Samer would like to start his own business and buy some iron to resell. Since he knows the construction supplies market, he will be successful in his new project.

Samer took a 2,000 USD startup loan from FATEN. This loan will provide him with some liquidity to start his project.

loans.use: to buy iron to resell.

loans.name: Baraa

texts.en:
Baraa is a 19-year-old single young man. His father is a worker with a very low income that barely covers the family's needs. Baraa is a university student who wants to complete his studies.

He is requesting a 400 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Baraa to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Baraa and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Chinda is 44 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

Chinda makes a living selling desserts. She earns about USD 12 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of USD 10 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about USD 6 each day. 

In order to improve her husband’s business, Chinda requests a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase more construction tools for her husband to use in his work. This purchase will help him obtain enough tools to use and enable him to bid for bigger construction projects. 

In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop for her children and send her youngest child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more construction tools for her husband to use in his work.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Yasmeen is a 31-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in a small house in Khanyounis city. Her husband is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Yasmeen and her husband are working to earn fair wages to provide a good life for their children. Now they would like to buy a solar heating system to provide warm water for their house. This will provide the family with enough clean water and also reduce their electricity use.

Yasmeen is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN. This will help Yasmeen to cover the solar heater's cost and provide suitable living conditions for  her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar heating system for her home.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines, which she has been in for 21 years now.

Carmelita requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lucy works hard to support her family.

She has a jeepney transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from sugarcane farming and a general store. Lucy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepney transport business.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepney transport.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks, like mineral water, soft drinks, biscuits, and other groceries needed for her general store business.

Myrna has been in this business for 13 years. Myrna earns additional income from food-vending. Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks, like mineral water, soft drinks, biscuits, and other groceries needed for her business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda works hard to support her family. Nilda is married and has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.

Nilda requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Nilda has been in this business for 22 years now. In the future, Nilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora, a 54-year-old married mother of three, earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in the business for 12 years and also earns income from farming sugarcane. Rhodora is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her pig pens and purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rhodora is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her pig pens and feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vyacheslav

texts.ru:
Вячеслав  - фермер. С 1985 года занимается выращиванием бахчевых культур арбуза и дыни.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогают двое детей старшему 31год, младшему 25 лет.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания молодой дыни.
Вячеслав решил приобрести семена дыни, пленку для защиты от холода и ветра, капельную ленту для полива.
В планах на будущее:  приобрести трактор и навесное оборудование к нему для обработки и вспашки своего земельного участка.
В личных планах: Достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования семян дыни, пленки и капельной ленты.
texts.en: Vyacheslav is a farmer and has been growing watermelons and cantaloupe since 1985.  His two children, aged 31 and 25, help him with his work.  The growth of his business started by planting young melons.  Vyacheslav has decided to purchase melon seeds, plastic to protect his crops from cold and wind, and hosing for irrigation.  In the future, he plans on buying a tractor with a till attachment to work his land.  His personal plans include finishing construction on his home.  He needs your financial support to purchase melon seeds, plastic and hosing.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment and seeds

loans.name: Lesya

texts.ru:
Леся уже пользовалась финансовой помощью от КИВА. Ее бизнес получил существенное вливание в разгар летнего сезона, когда шлепанцы быстро изнашиваются. Леся смогла не упустить своего покупателя, получив хороший доход, реализовав предыдущую партию товара. 
В этот раз Леся обратилась за дополнительным финансированием в размере 20 000 гривен, чтобы закупить дополнительную партию весенних ботинок под реализацию на своей точке.
texts.en: Lesya has already benefited from the financial support of Kiva.  She received a significant infusion of business at the height of summer when slippers wear out quickly.  She was prepared, having received a good income once the previous inventory had sold.  This time, Lesya is taking out a supplemental loan of 20,000 griven to buy a new assortment of shoes to sell at her store.

loans.use: To purchase an additional assortment of spring shoes to sell at her store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 56 years old and married with seven children.  She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines and has been doing so for 7 years.  She also earns additional income from buying/selling vegetables and from raising livestock.

Lolita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to pay for laborer's salaries and to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer for her business.  She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of expanding her business.

loans.use: to pay for laborer's salaries and to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.
